name: 1-UP
effects:
“That's not my name!”
Cooldown: Upon death

“Time to hitch another ride.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: A Cheat
effects: This character will lie whenever they get the chance. Sometimes this character will lie for no reason other than they can. While lying might help them get ahead, if they're not careful they can become caught in a web of their own lies.

name: A Flirt
effects: This character will commonly flirt with others when given the chance. This trait does not mean they are good at flirting however.

name: Abomination
effects:
“Well, aren't you special?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Accent
effects: This character speaks with a certain accent from a certain region or species, a lisp, has a speech abnormality.

name: Achilles Rage
effects:
“Aim for the heels...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Acrobat
effects: This character is much more vertically gifted than the average member of their species, and is capable of a wide variety of parkour techniques and gymnastic feats. They can easily leap tall barriers, cross dangerous pits, and evade pursuers without missing a jump.

name: Acrobatic
effects: This character is much more vertically gifted than the average member of their species, and is capable of a wide variety of parkour techniques and gymnastic feats. They can easily leap tall barriers, cross dangerous pits, and evade pursuers without missing a jump.

name: Adaptive
effects: This character is more able to survive in an unfavorable environment, given time. This character is able to handle radical changes without folding under pressure.

name: Addict
effects: This character is addicted to some sort of substance and loses sanity, morale, or possibly even health if they go without it for too long.

name: Addicted to X
effects: This character is addicted to some sort of substance and loses sanity, morale, or possibly even health if they go without it for too long.

name: Adorable
effects: Aww, well aren't you just precious! People are easily endeared to this character with their puppy-like look. Their presence is often additionally capable of increasing morale for the crew, assuming they like sweet things.

name: Adrenaline Junkie
effects:
This character loves danger and has a trait that they gain whenever they are in peril. Every day that this trait goes without activation this character will lose morale. 
Cooldown: Activated whenever this character is scared or in danger.

name: Adrenaline Rush
effects:
This character can overclock themselves for a short time, giving themselves +3 strength for that time limit. Overclocking can go past the 10 point cap, but is not allowed to go past 15. Every time this character overclocks they have a 20% chance of instantly passing out before the buff can be applied and a 10% chance of causing permanent damage to themselves which will remove a single point of intelligence or break a limb if really unlucky. If intelligence hits zero they die. 
Cooldown: None

name: Adventurous
effects: This character will answer the call to adventure more often than not. With this trait they are more likely to run into places with more loot to be found. This character is less daunted by certain situations and morale is raised whenever they're put in an adventurous situation. This character may have fears, but they're willing to meet it face to face.

name: Aerial
effects: Through wings or otherwise, this character is able to fly.

name: Aerodynamic
effects: This character is much more vertically gifted than the average member of their species, and is capable of a wide variety of parkour techniques and gymnastic feats. They can easily leap tall barriers, cross dangerous pits, and evade pursuers without missing a jump.

name: Aggressive
effects: This character prefers to let their fist equivalents do the talking. They will regularly threaten others with physical violence, and will happily jump on any opportunity to bring harm upon their enemies or anyone who gets in their way.

name: Aggressively Religious
effects: This character is very aggressive about their faith, whatever it may be. Having it questioned may lead them to become violent, verbally and/or physically.

name: Agreeable
effects: This character is disposed to be agreeable and obliging, but not to a point it would present any significant danger to them.

name: Aid
effects:
This character can give a helping hand to any character making a check of any ability. This is done as the check is occurring, the character will roll a die half the size of the original and whatever number shows will be added to the roll.
Cooldown: Twice per day

name: Aim isn't getting better
effects: This character rarely lands hits, whether firing a weapon or throwing a bean bag.

name: Airhorn
effects:
Twice per day this character can produce a specific noise or say a specific word and drastically reduce the sanity of all other characters in earshot.
Cooldown: Twice per day.

name: Albino
effects: This character is whatever an albino in their species looks like.

name: Alibi
effects:
Replaces another character's red trait with a random green trait for a temporary amount of time.
Cooldown: Once a day

name: All for One
effects:
When activated, pick a stat and a character. All other characters will have this stat lowered to 1, while the character picked gets the total of all those stat points added to them for a short time.
Cooldown: Twice a day.

name: All or None
effects:
“There is no in between.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Allergic to X
effects: This character is allergic to X and has bad reactions when exposed to X. This character may need to take medication to lessen reactions to X and if not done their reaction to X can become fatal.

name: Alone
effects:
“Nobody's Coming”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Aloof
effects: This character is emotionally distant. This could be natural or a defense mechanism, but either way, they come off as cold, uncaring, and unaffected. They treat serious situations with a clear detachment that makes others feel like they're not being heard.

name: Alpha
effects: This character feels they are the Head of the pack so to speak, even if they aren't. This character feels the need to dominant everyone around them. They may do Power moves to show and scare other people around them into submitting. While this gains them power, everyone around them will quickly be drained emotionally and sometimes physically. Characters may avoid them, leaving them no one left on their side.

name: Alpha Female
effects: This character feels they are the Head of the pack so to speak, even if they aren't. This character feels the need to dominant everyone around them. They may do Power moves to show and scare other people around them into submitting. While this gains them power, everyone around them will quickly be drained emotionally and sometimes physically. Characters may avoid them, leaving them no one left on their side.

name: Alpha Male
effects: This character feels they are the Head of the pack so to speak, even if they aren't. This character feels the need to dominant everyone around them. They may do Power moves to show and scare other people around them into submitting. While this gains them power, everyone around them will quickly be drained emotionally and sometimes physically. Characters may avoid them, leaving them no one left on their side.

name: Alt Name
effects:
Description
Restrictions: Generic Only

name: Always Late
effects: This character can never make it on time, whether it is for work, to battle, or even the birth of their child, this character can never come on time. Most people won't trust this character with time related tasks or will supervise them so they hurry.

name: Always Late
effects: Whatever the case, this character is always late to things, be it meetings, events or other such things.

name: Always On Time
effects: This character will always do things at the scheduled time or when told to. Most of the time they will even be way ahead of time to make sure they don't miss anything. This character will also encourage others around them to not be late.

name: Always watched
effects:
“You are the star of the show! Maybe. The audience likes you anyway. You think?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Ambiguous in speech
effects:
This character speaks in riddles, code, and tends to be extremely hidden about their words. Due to this it's extremely hard for people around them to understand what they are trying to say. This character might be so dedicated to their riddles that they are willing to endanger others with their unwillingness to stop.
Ex: This character knows about a monster coming up, this character will tell the people who are heading towards the monster a riddle about how there is a monster in the next room without saying directly there is a monster and they need to prepare for it.

name: Ambitious
effects: This character has strong ambition for a goal or several goals. They won't be easily dissuaded from a course of action. The ambition this character holds may be for the better or the worse.

name: Amnesia
effects:
This character has lost most of or all memories of who they were.
Restrictions: [Reprogrammed] applies to AIs only. [Amnesia] can be removed if this character rediscovers themselves, or, in a robot's case, is dropped back into their default programming.

name: Amorphous
effects:
“I think we should put this one back in the test tube, Larry.”
Cooldown:

name: Animal Communer
effects: This character is more likely to be in tune with animals. While they cannot speak "animal" they are able to understand their emotions and the animal is likely able to understand them.

name: Animal Vendetta
effects: Characters with this trait take a personal hate against some sort of fauna or flora and will take every moment to shit-talk about it, occasionally this characters will get a a moral and sanity debuff if they get near any fauna that looks like the type of animal they hate and will take their time hating it in the internet or hunting it.

name: Annoying
effects: This character is just annoying in general, either by making obnoxious sounds, snarky yet rude comments, or a large list of unpleasant things. Sometimes they may not even know that they're annoying others, which just adds to people's frustrations. They will slowly drain morale and sanity from crew members.

name: Anxiety
effects: This character is easily stressed and prone to panicking in situations that become too much for them. Depending on the type of character they may shut down, become aggressive, break down, act irrational, or become lost and flighty. It may get so bad that panicking becomes the norm for this character.

name: Apathetic
effects: This character is emotionally distant. This could be natural or a defense mechanism, but either way, they come off as cold, uncaring, and unaffected. They treat serious situations with a clear detachment that makes others feel like they're not being heard.

name: Apologetic
effects: This character tends to apologize when things go wrong, no matter how minor, or if they even had anything to do with what happened at all. This can get them in trouble, as some may find this annoying, and their apologizing may lead others to assume they did whatever they've apologized for, even if they did not. However, some characters may take pity on this character, and comfort them when they seemingly apologize for no reason.

name: Aqua-Adapted
effects: Unusual for their species, this character is incredibly good at swimming, and can stay underwater for hours at a time, if not indefinitely. They might possess fins, webbing, or even gills that allow them to breathe underwater.

name: Aquatic
effects: This character can only live in fairly specific conditions, which might not be suitable for general travel on a space ship. For instance, an [Aquatic] character would need to constantly be in water, while a [Xeric] character would need to be constantly heated and dry.

name: Argues
effects: This character is more likely to have verbal arguments with everyone around them, including crewmates.

name: Argues Like A Lawyer
effects: This character is capable of confusing or arguing their case well enough to confuse most people into agreeing. Utilizes intelligence instead of charisma in appropriate situations to boost the chances of convincing the other even when they make little real sense.

name: Argumental
effects: This character is more likely to have verbal arguments with everyone around them, including crewmates.

name: Argumentative
effects: This character is more likely to have verbal arguments with everyone around them, including crewmates.

name: Artful Dodger
effects: This character is a good dodger, and they will have a better chance of avoiding attacks.

name: Artist
effects: This character is skilled at some sort of visual art. This could mean painting, drawing, digital art, or just about anything.

name: Athletic
effects:
Characters with this trait take extra good care of their mind and body, and are healthier in general. They tend to live longer and recover much quicker from injury and disease.
Restrictions: This trait can be lost if the character begins to engage in certain activities to degrees unhealthy.

name: Attention Seeker
effects: This character wants attention. They are obsessive over it, and will do anything and everything to get attention from others, whether it's faking injuries, mental conditions, or making up any types of stories about themselves to grab a person's attention. Attention seekers may even tell half truths to spice up their stories to make themselves seem more heroic.

name: Attitude
effects: Whether by intention or a passive tic, this character will at some times make snarky, rude comments in normal conversation. Most of the time this is only an annoyance at worst, but in some rare cases this character will hit a soft spot and will have to deal with the consequences. This trait is a lesser form of [Provocative].

name: Attractive
effects: Most people find this character to be very attractive. They can charm others with their looks alone, and will often recieve special attention as a result.

name: Augh my eyes
effects:
This character can emit a twinkling cloud of raw attractiveness. This is useless as a light source, but accentuates the character's beauty and temporarily boosts their charisma by 1d10 for a single encounter.
Cooldown: Once per day.

name: Augmented
effects:
“You're not an X anymore, huh?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Authority Aggressor
effects: This character has a kind of inferiority complex where, if they feel someone is better in some way, then this character will act hostile to that person. This is different from [Disloyal] in that it's not that they don't want to listen to authority, more so they feel intimidated by it.

name: Auto-Attack
effects: This character will automatically attack anyone, including teammates, when a certain condition is met such as getting too close to them or saying a certain word.

name: Auto-Translator
effects:
This character can translate what a person is saying even without hearing the language before.
Restrictions: This trait is an aftik-only trait.

name: Awake at Dawn
effects:
This character is typically awake during the day, and sleeps during the night.
Restrictions: Cannot have the traits [Nocturnal] or [Crepescular]

name: Awake at Twilight
effects: Character is neither fully [Diurnal] or [Nocturnal], but instead is mostly awake during the transitional periods between the two.

name: Awesome sense of X
effects: This character has fantastic X senses or has high senses in general.

name: Azure Song
effects:
When this character sings characters that can hear the song are driven into a deep, paralyzing state of sorrow. This effect ends when the character stops singing.
Cooldown: Once daily.

name: BACK OFF
effects: This character has a designated area they call "their territory". They are violently protective of it and are willing to hurt and kill to keep teammates and strangers alike away. If this character were to ever let someone in intentionally, this would possibly mean that they hold great emotion for the guest, or they plan to hurt them.

name: BEES
effects:
This character is host to thousands of bees and wasps, which does not usually harm or impede them notably. On command, they may shoot a swarm of these bees at a target, instructing them to mercilessly sting it, before returning back to the body to rest.
Cooldown: Twice per day

name: BO
effects: This character's Charisma score is lowered to 1 for all who can smell the repulsive odor wafting from their various, unwashed pores. Gross.

name: BS
effects:
This character can bluff about anything and tells a convincing lie. Automatically pass one intelligence or charisma check. 
Cooldown: Once a day.

name: Bad Liar
effects: This character is terrible at deception. When other characters are listening to them talk, they will be able to detect any attempted falsehoods made by the character as though the listener had [Lie Detector].

name: Bad Memory
effects: This character is prone to forgetting. While keeping diaries and logs certainly help, the character may still become lost with them.

name: Bad Omen
effects:
This trait makes the character's luck drop to zero.
Restrictions: For use with controller traits like [Moodmeter].

name: Bad at X
effects: The character is bad at this task or ability. They will often fail at it, become stressed, and lose morale if they are made to do it.

name: Baked And Buttered
effects: If a character within this character's sight uses [Raw Intimidation], that character and their potato explode in a fiery blaze. Any intimidation generated fails and one ration is produced.

name: Basic
effects: This character leads an humble lifestyle and doesn't concern themselves with luxury and elegance. Characters with this trait may dislike working with hi-tech equipment, or fancy tools.

name: Battle Planner
effects: This character is naturally skilled in tactical thinking, and is almost always one step ahead. When in combat, a character with this trait is able to perform special actions and can inform their teammates of the best movements to make.

name: Beautiful
effects: Most people find this character to be very attractive. They can charm others with their looks alone, and will often recieve special attention as a result.

name: Bee Caller
effects:
This character is host to thousands of bees and wasps, which does not usually harm or impede them notably. On command, they may shoot a swarm of these bees at a target, instructing them to mercilessly sting it, before returning back to the body to rest.
Cooldown: Twice per day

name: Beep Boop
effects: This character tends to have one response for all questions.

name: Beginner
effects:
“Everything always seems to start well...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Bendy
effects: This character can fit themselves into small spaces and are quick on their feet. This character's agility stat goes beyond the 10 rule.

name: Better Together
effects:
This character is able to combine into a fusion with another character to temporarily work together. Their stats are slightly better, or worse, based on the person they are combining with.
Cooldown: No cooldown, but damages the users when it splits them. How long it lasts is based on hybrid compatibility, with the possibility of it ending instantly.

name: Beyond Saving
effects: Ever feel like the whole universe wants you dead? This character does. Advanced form of [Goner]. This character automatically fails any roll that would cause injury or harm to them, and receives no miracle roll. The character receives a single additional green trait.

name: Big Eater
effects: This character will eat twice as much rations when it's meal time. They will also starve twice as fast due to the amount of energy they need.

name: Big Pockets
effects: This character can carry +4 more than what their stats would normally allow.

name: Big Spender
effects: This character has a tendency to spend a lot of money on one item or spend a lot of money on several items, whether or not they may be useful. They may also be liable to go on a shopping spree. Characters affected by this trait tend to have a morale boost after shopping before sharply declining as they end up regretting their actions. To cheer themself up, they might shop a little more.

name: BigMcLargeHuge
effects: This character is bigger, stronger, and more durable than their peers by a fairly significant amount, often towering over their smaller kin. Tends to have various size related issues, such as having to duck when going through doorways and having a hard time finding equipment in their size.

name: Bilingual
effects: Through usually quite a lot of research and training, this character may know two or more languages. Of course this doesn't mean they know every single language nor do they know every single word of said language.

name: Bio-luminescent
effects: This character emits light naturally.

name: Bird Magnet
effects: This character attracts a lot of birds to them of various shapes, sizes, and sentience levels. This character is really for the birds!

name: Bishie sparkles
effects:
This character can emit a twinkling cloud of raw attractiveness. This is useless as a light source, but accentuates the character's beauty and temporarily boosts their charisma by 1d10 for a single encounter.
Cooldown: Once per day.

name: Black Cat
effects:
“When a black cat crosses your path...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Blame Magnet
effects: For whatever reason; this character is blamed for everything that happens nearby.

name: Blaze of Chaos
effects:
“Oh! Let's see what happens!!!”
Cooldown: Upon Death

name: Blaze of Glory
effects:
Whenever this character receives what would be a fatal blow, they gain a +5 to Strength and Endurance, and +3 to luck, and may help defeat the enemy(s) that dealt the blow. When the fight is over, the character dies. 
Cooldown: Only activated upon receiving a would-be fatal blow.
Restrictions: Can only be used with characters with 7+ Luck or 7+ Endurance.

name: Blind
effects: This character has some sort of major sight problem, it could be due to genetics, injury, or anything else. How bad their sight is can range from fairly bad sight even with corrective eye-ware, all the way to total blindness. This character is more likely to miss visual based cues.

name: Blood Curdling
effects:
“What makes your blood boil?”
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Controller activated trait only.

name: Blood Money
effects:
While this ability is active, the character using it will lose credits instead of getting hurt. This is very expensive. 
Cooldown: Can be used anytime, but the ability won't work if preventing an injury would leave the character to have a credits total below zero.

name: Blood Pumper
effects: This character passively causes other characters to get more excited, awake and emotional when nearby. This may increase the morale of those nearby and make them be more confident. This will only work for organic people, while Empowering will only work for mechanical people.  This trait is the opposite of [Calming Presence].

name: Bloodhound
effects:
This character can track smells extremely well and from very far away. More often than not they are able to track the location of the source with ease.
Restrictions: Character must be capable of smell, character will lose this trait if they are incapable of smelling.

name: Blue
effects:
This character is blue.
Restrictions: Only applies to generic who are blue.

name: Blurts words
effects: This character cannot always control what they say and will sometimes say rude or hurtful things without meaning it. They may also agree to things they do not want to do or deny what they wish to do. This trait can cause distress to the character, people around them or both.

name: Body Builder
effects: This character has spent their life working on themselves, being naturally muscular looking. This character can break the 10 strength cap and go up to 15.

name: Body Swap
effects:
“Walk a mile in someone else's shoes.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Bored Eater
effects: This character will consume rations when they have nothing to do. When they don't have jobs or hobbies to keep themselves busy with, this character will empty food stocks quickly.

name: Boring
effects: This character is just boring to be honest. Nothing to see here. Most people will lose sanity just hearing them drone about a subject.

name: Bottled Rage
effects: This character will store away their anger or other such emotions whenever they feel them and won't tell others about the anger they're feeling. Because of this, after too much anger has been stored up, they will be prone to burst at even the smallest thing and fly into a fit of rage.

name: Bottomless Pit
effects: This character will eat twice as much rations when it's meal time. They will also starve twice as fast due to the amount of energy they need.

name: Brat
effects: This character has perhaps been overindulged by their parents or caregivers and has evolved a special kind of attitude because of it. A character with this trait resorts to very immature and often self-centered endeavors in order to get their way. It's common for this character to exhibit temper tantrums or even manipulation.

name: Brave
effects: This character will answer the call to adventure more often than not. With this trait they are more likely to run into places with more loot to be found. This character is less daunted by certain situations and morale is raised whenever they're put in an adventurous situation. This character may have fears, but they're willing to meet it face to face.

name: Breakable
effects:
This character is not known for their durability.
Restrictions: A character with this trait may not have their Endurance stat rise above 4.

name: Broadway Here I Come
effects:
Anybody with this ability can do a variety of acts with their feet such as spelling out any word with their feet, tap dancing like a pro with their feet, and doing fire poi (with their feet of course). For some reason, this will boost their charisma by +3 with anybody that witnessed their act.
Cooldown:  2 times per day.
Restrictions: They have to have feet.

name: Broken
effects: This character has gone through something traumatic or depressing that has left them feeling as if they are broken on the inside even if nothing is wrong with them. They suffer a near permanent moral and sanity loss, and lose morale and sanity faster than normal characters.

name: Broken Luck
effects:
“May the odds be ever in someone's favor.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Broken Person
effects: This character has gone through something traumatic or depressing that has left them feeling as if they are broken on the inside even if nothing is wrong with them. They suffer a near permanent moral and sanity loss, and lose morale and sanity faster than normal characters.

name: Broken Record
effects: This character ends up in the same situation often. This is not a time loop but just an odd event.

name: Broken Watch
effects: This character will often lose track of time, whether saying they'll be five minutes when they actually mean an hour, underestimating how long projects take, or scheduling more than they can handle. Sometimes they may hyper focus on a task and forget other obligations as time rolls by.

name: Buddy-Cop
effects:
This character and another character are linked by having this trait. The two likely work or live together, and likely have little to nothing in common. They may or may not like each other, but they can operate with each other.
Restrictions: Requires 2 characters.

name: Bug Magnet
effects: Whenever this character interacts with an electronic device of some sort, that device has a very high chance of having a software issue of some kind.

name: Built-In Compass
effects: This character will always know where north is, even if there is no way to discern where north is.

name: Built-in Weapons
effects:
This character was born with weapons, or has fused weapons with their flesh.
Restrictions: This trait is for clockworks only. Any other weapon that is attached to a character is considered an item.

name: Bullet Sponge
effects:
This character takes reduced damage from ranged weapons.
Restrictions: Does not include thrown weapons like spears.

name: Bullet Time
effects:
This character can automatically dodge things that would potentially cripple or kill them, or otherwise deeply incapacitate them.
Cooldown: Once a day.
Restrictions: This trait may only be on characters with 5+ Agility.

name: Bullseye Shot
effects: This character almost never misses a shot. This may apply just to skills they have been trained in. For instance, a surgeon with this skill would be extremely unlikely to miss a small, precise incision that a normal surgeon might slip up on.

name: Bully
effects: This character feels they are the Head of the pack so to speak, even if they aren't. This character feels the need to dominant everyone around them. They may do Power moves to show and scare other people around them into submitting. While this gains them power, everyone around them will quickly be drained emotionally and sometimes physically. Characters may avoid them, leaving them no one left on their side.

name: Bushy
effects: This character has a very large, unkempt amount of fur/hair/feather, more than what is normal for their species.

name: CAPS LOCK
effects: This character speaks very loudly or can yell loudly when they want to. As such they slightly better than most at intimidation, but may annoy their crewmates or attract unwanted attention.

name: CFF
effects:
“Now we are cosmic friends forever... and ever...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Call The Cavalry
effects:
When activated, this ability will summon a random character the user has met to the scene. This character needn't necessarily be able to help and may make matters worse, intentionally or otherwise.
Cooldown: Useable once a day.
Restrictions: A luck stat of 7 or more.

name: Calligraphy Champion
effects: This character has fantastic handwriting. Any written material they make has a professional feel and boosts the emotions felt by the piece. This can cause people to be riled up more by a call to action, or feel more calmed by a poster saying to ignore something.

name: Callout Master
effects:
This character can damage the reputation of a target by revealing information about them to others. Whether at information is true or not won't matter, as the audience won't be able to see the target the same anymore.
Cooldown: Twice per day, but only once per person.

name: Calm
effects: This character tends to be calmer than most and is slightly more likely to be able to calm down faster in tense situations and clear their mind.

name: Calm Under Pressure
effects: When situations come at this character, they remain calm and collected. They are able to think clearly in nearly all situations.

name: Calming Presence
effects: This character has an effect on other characters ranging from calming the aggressive and adversarial drives of other organic beings, producing a slight euphoric feeling, producing a sense of trust, or slight sedation. This works on organic beings only; [Lodestone] applies to mechanical beings.

name: Can Walk on Walls
effects: This character can walk on walls.

name: Can eat trash
effects: This character takes no penalties from eating rotten or rancid rations. In fact, it's good for them.

name: Can't Lie
effects: This character just cannot tell a lie, even if it's a white lie, or would be detrimental to tell the truth. If they are ever forced to lie against their will, they will take a large sanity hit, and may continue to worry about it until the truth comes out.

name: Cannibal
effects: This character will eat not only characters of their own species but will also eat other sentient beings. The moment that if the character runs out of food they will attempt to eat others nearby. This character may also eat sentient beings even if they have food.

name: Capoeirista
effects:
This character is skilled in the martial art of acrobatic dance fighting. When background music is playing, this character gains +2 agility, any attacks they make have a 20% chance of hitting if they would have missed, and any attacks against them have a 20% chance of missing if they would have otherwise hit. If [Timed Hits] is active, this applies to each successive hit, making it more likely for them to string long hits against opponents and to break an opponent's string of hits before it gets long. 
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Activates only when music is playing.

name: Careful
effects: This character will be more nervous of suspicious situations, and less willing to take risks. They may put extra effort into making sure everything is safe before feeling comfortable. While this normally makes things safer for them, it can also be a huge time waster.

name: Cassandra Complex
effects: However this character communicates, others will tend to assume they're lying, attempting to mislead, or their words cannot otherwise be trusted.

name: Cat Killer
effects: This character sees danger or drama and tends to runs towards it to watch it. They weighed the pros and cons, and are FULLY aware of the danger they're putting themselves through. This puts them in the line of danger far more often

name: Cautious
effects: This character will be more nervous of suspicious situations, and less willing to take risks. They may put extra effort into making sure everything is safe before feeling comfortable. While this normally makes things safer for them, it can also be a huge time waster.

name: Cavalry
effects: This character is instinctively adept at the control of any vehicle or ridden creature they attempt to pilot or command, able to make maneuvers even when in stressfull situations.

name: Changed
effects: This character has been changed for the statistically better. This trait is only gained when a character undergoes a major, most likely sudden change.

name: Changed X
effects: This character has been changed for the statistically better. This trait is only gained when a character undergoes a major, most likely sudden change.

name: Changed for the better
effects: This character has been changed for the statistically better. This trait is only gained when a character undergoes a major, most likely sudden change.

name: Chaos
effects:
“You'll never have a normal day ever again!”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Charismatic
effects:
This character automatically gains 10 in Charisma.
Restrictions: This trait is only allowed with controller traits such as Moodmeter.

name: Charitable
effects: This character is more likely to share what they have to the less fortunate, whether that be money, a home or any other such thing. The opposite of [Greedy].

name: Charming Drunk
effects: This character will receive a small bonus in charisma when they are wasted. This does not make them any less drunk.

name: Chatterbox
effects: This character will talk for ages if allowed and rarely runs out of anything to say.

name: Chatty
effects: This character will talk for ages if allowed and rarely runs out of anything to say.

name: Cheapskate
effects: This character knows the tricks of the trade when it comes to haggling down prices and sniffing out good deals. When browsing through shops, items being sold may be listed for much less than they're worth.

name: Cheater
effects: This character doesn't believe in playing fair. If they see an opportunity to rig the odds in their favor, they will take advantage of it. This can land them in deep trouble if they get caught.

name: Check Check
effects:
“Job works at Bob.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Cheers, love! The cavalry's here!
effects:
When activated, this ability will summon a random character the user has met to the scene. This character needn't necessarily be able to help and may make matters worse, intentionally or otherwise.
Cooldown: Useable once a day.
Restrictions: A luck stat of 7 or more.

name: Chemical Resistance
effects: This character can resist or is outright immune to the harmful effects of poisons, drugs, and toxins in general. Whether breathed in, injected or consumed, their effect will be at least greatly reduced.

name: Chic Magnet
effects: This character has a sense of fashion and will get a boost in charisma when talking to other characters that like fashion.

name: Chick Magnet
effects: This character attracts a lot of birds to them of various shapes, sizes, and sentience levels. This character is really for the birds!

name: Chicken
effects: This character will always try to back down from a fight, though they will still act in self-defense if they don't have a choice. If forced into dangerous situations, they will suffer morale loss, and will be more inclined than most to abandon their crewmates.

name: Childish
effects: This character is very childish. Although this can be seen as cute sometimes, it can also be very annoying.

name: Chilling
effects: This character commonly puts anyone around them on edge by presence alone. Everyday they are with someone, the sanity of the person goes slightly down.

name: Chip Magnet
effects: This character's Charisma is boosted to a 10 with robots and AIs. Robots and AIs will commonly find this character attractive.

name: Chips Magnet
effects: This character is a natural born gambler. They will gladly gamble away some of their credits on any game of luck.

name: Chromatic
effects: When viewed by others, this character will always appear to have a chromatic aberration effect. This may make them uncomfortable to look at.

name: Chronic Apologizer
effects: This character tends to apologize when things go wrong, no matter how minor, or if they even had anything to do with what happened at all. This can get them in trouble, as some may find this annoying, and their apologizing may lead others to assume they did whatever they've apologized for, even if they did not. However, some characters may take pity on this character, and comfort them when they seemingly apologize for no reason.

name: Chronic Pain
effects: This character will always feel physical pain, either in general or in just certain areas of their body. This constant pain could have been cased by an event or accident, but also could have been caused by illness.

name: Chronologically Challenged
effects: This character can never make it on time, whether it is for work, to battle, or even the birth of their child, this character can never come on time. Most people won't trust this character with time related tasks or will supervise them so they hurry.

name: Classist
effects: This character judges people on what they believe person stands in the social order. This is unlike the [Speciesist] trait as a character who is classist does not judge a person solely on their species. A character who is classist can be rich oriented, seeing the rich as better than the poor, or reversed, seeing the poor as completely noble and the rich as pure evil with no redeeming factors.

name: Clean Freak
effects: This character is obsessed with being clean and will refuse to do dirty jobs. If they do get dirty somehow, they will suffer a sanity loss. This character will also keep their living environment as clean as they're able, and can get frustrated if it's dirtied up.

name: Clear-Headed
effects: When situations come at this character, they remain calm and collected. They are able to think clearly in nearly all situations.

name: Clear-headed
effects: This character tends to be calmer than most and is slightly more likely to be able to calm down faster in tense situations and clear their mind.

name: Climber
effects: This character is able to quickly climb obstacles that stand in their way, as easily as the average person can run and jump. They have an eye for climbable terrain, and even surfaces that are too steep or smooth to climb will not stop them for long.

name: Clingy
effects: This character has a person, or in rarer cases an object, that they cling to. This character will become distressed whenever this person or object is moved away from them. When this character has no one to cling to they will find someone else to cling to. Due to this clinging, this character can be easily manipulated by who or what they are clinging to.

name: Clone
effects:
“You've found yourself, but not in the way you expected.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Cloud nine
effects: This character, whether by a naturalist's intuition or years of study, is very good at predicting the weather. They can sense the forecast in a new location just by glancing at the sky or feeling the breeze on their face. Characters with this trait will usually be prepared for all but the most extreme weather patterns.

name: Clown
effects:
“Honk, honk!”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Clumsy
effects: This character is more likely to drop objects or make small mistakes. Sometimes their mistakes end up being for the better, but most of the time the mistake are small.

name: Clutz
effects: An advanced version of [Clumsy], this character has trouble even handling simple tools because of their poor dexterity.

name: Cocky
effects: This character boasts about their skills, and often want people to watch them do things to show off how good they are at it.

name: Code Phrase
effects:
“The numbers, Mason!”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Code Talker
effects: This character is able to decipher any coded speech, writing, or just about anything else that's in code if given enough time.

name: Collector
effects: This character has a collection of items or does lowkey hoarding of random objects they find. They are more likely to pick up just about anything they find and check it out. If an item is removed from their collection without their approval they may become minorly distressed. For the red negative version of this please see [Extreme Hoarding].

name: Color Changer
effects: This character is able to change their colors in response to specific stimuli.

name: Color-Blind
effects: This character has one of many types of color blindness. While this is very unlikely to ever be an issue, it does change the way the player sees the world when being that character.

name: Come Get a Whiff of This!
effects:
This character, whether it be by natural means or a cologne/perfume, has a scent that is appealing other to people. If the other characters(s) can smell this odor, this character will gain a slight boost in charisma.
Restrictions: This trait will not activate if the other party does not have any type of scent glands to smell this character with or does not have an adequately developed sense of smell.
otherVersions: Come Get a Whiff of This!

name: Comedy Gold
effects:
“"Haha! Such a funny comedian you are!"”
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Does not apply to writing or sign language.

name: Comical
effects: This character has a humorous personality and likes to joke and play around with others. In most cases their japes are harmless, though they are not necessarily funny and can really try the patience of those less easily amused.

name: Commanding
effects: This character is a natural-born leader. Crewmates and strangers alike will feel compelled to follow their command, even if they are otherwise unwilling to work together.

name: Compassionate
effects: This character is not only considerate of others, but is also very understanding of other's issues. This person is good at seeing things from other's points of view and seeing how people's issues would make them feel. Others may want to talk to this character about their problems as they will understand, and may feel bad for them and try to comfort them. However, their sensitive side means it may be easier to hurt this character's feelings.

name: Compelling
effects: This character not only has a way with words but people are ready and willing to listen. This trait means this character has a better chance when trying to convince a character to do a deed. Sometimes this character might even be willing to convince others to do things they'd never even consider before.

name: Competitive
effects: This character tends to be up for healthy challenges. If this character sees a co-worker or someone they see as a rival working harder than they are they may work even harder to compete with this person even if this person has no idea what they are doing or even if they exist.

name: Compulsive Liar
effects: This character will lie whenever they get the chance. Sometimes this character will lie for no reason other than they can. While lying might help them get ahead, if they're not careful they can become caught in a web of their own lies.

name: Conceited
effects: Often going hand in hand with [Narcissist], this character believes that they are so far above everyone else, they would need a periscope just to look them in the eyes. Their treatment towards others reflects this.

name: Condescending
effects: This person often thinks they are higher than other people in someway, such as intellectually, psychically, monetary, or otherwise. They will often flaunt this fact in someway, such as giving goods, or just loudly proclaiming it whenever a "lesser" is failing at a task they could do. Many do not actually mean to offend, and believe they're doing a friendly gesture or making an observation without realizing the annoyance of the other party.

name: Confident
effects: This character is confident in what they do and rarely ever doubts themselves or the people they believe in. They're able to trust people and can raise the morale of people they trust.

name: Confront Blanket
effects:
“Anything can be dangerous if you put your mind to it.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Connections
effects: This character has some sort of important connection to someone else. These connections often times owe the character a few favors.

name: Connections to X
effects: This character has some sort of important connection to someone else. These connections often times owe the character a few favors.

name: Conscriptable
effects: If a non-military or military emergency is declared nearby by an authority with jurisdiction over an organization this character belongs to, this character will be notified with a call to serve a duty. They can choose to accept or else they may face consequences for failing to serve. [Emergency Conscript] means the character only can be called for non-military emergencies; [Military Reserve] means the character only serves military emergencies. The range for emergencies the character can be called to depends upon the severity level of the emergency: for instance, a fire may only trigger reserve-conscripts within an hour's travel time; a rare event like a star forecast to go supernova may call upon all conscripts within two warps.

name: Conspiracist
effects: This character is inclined to draw connections between things that aren't really connected. Often these beliefs are related to overarching power structures and are rooted in distrust of those in control. The beliefs can manifest in strange behavior and even social isolation, but it's usually quite difficult to talk the character out of them.

name: Conspiracy Theorist
effects: This character is inclined to draw connections between things that aren't really connected. Often these beliefs are related to overarching power structures and are rooted in distrust of those in control. The beliefs can manifest in strange behavior and even social isolation, but it's usually quite difficult to talk the character out of them.

name: Constant Pain
effects: This character will always feel physical pain, either in general or in just certain areas of their body. This constant pain could have been cased by an event or accident, but also could have been caused by illness.

name: Contagious passion
effects:
This character is passionate about what they like to an extent that others are drawn in too. Having common ground with others makes it easier to be on good terms with them, but it can alienate others.
On a successful charisma check this character can give others [Likes X], and later [Passionate about X]. If a check fails a second time the other party will gain [Dislikes X].
Cooldown: Passive. Only applicable on a person once a day.
Restrictions: This character must have [Passionate about X]. If it is lost temporarily they will not be able to use this ability, and if permanently they will also lose this trait.

name: Contortionist
effects: This character can fit themselves into small spaces and are quick on their feet. This character's agility stat goes beyond the 10 rule.

name: Contrarian
effects: This character is habitually contrarian, and will voice disagreement with most opinions and ideas regardless of whether or not they actually do or do not agree with them, much to the consternation of people around them.

name: Controlling
effects: This character is CONSIDERABLY attached to an object, a person or something equivalent to those examples. If the target of this trait is removed, this character's morale will drop harshly and may react accordingly. If this is done too many times and/or for too long, this character may acquire additional red traits linked to this item, such as [Auto-Attack].

name: Convincing
effects: This character not only has a way with words but people are ready and willing to listen. This trait means this character has a better chance when trying to convince a character to do a deed. Sometimes this character might even be willing to convince others to do things they'd never even consider before.

name: Cool Under Pressure
effects: When situations come at this character, they remain calm and collected. They are able to think clearly in nearly all situations.

name: Cooperative
effects: This character does wonderfully in team situations and is always willing to follow plans. This character is almost always ready and willing to help and others rarely feel this character is dragging their feet in a team related operation.

name: Copycat
effects:
This character can temporarily copy a set of traits of another character. For example, this character can copy another character's yellow traits, and temporarily use the yellow traits that character has, or copy another character's purple traits.
Cooldown: Twice daily.

name: Cosmic Friends Forever
effects:
“Now we are cosmic friends forever... and ever...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Cosplayer
effects: This character enjoys Cosplay.

name: Coward
effects: This character will always try to back down from a fight, though they will still act in self-defense if they don't have a choice. If forced into dangerous situations, they will suffer morale loss, and will be more inclined than most to abandon their crewmates.

name: Craftsman
effects: This character is skilled at some sort of visual art. This could mean painting, drawing, digital art, or just about anything.

name: Crass
effects: This character cares very little about issues relating to anyone but them. They may make very insensitive comments towards people and voice how much they wish other characters would "get over it."

name: Creative
effects: This character is able to easily come up with new ideas and may be able to lessen the cost for current items. In a tough situation this character is likely able to use simple items to create make-shift weapons or items.

name: Creepy
effects: This character commonly puts anyone around them on edge by presence alone. Everyday they are with someone, the sanity of the person goes slightly down.

name: Crepuscular
effects: Character is neither fully [Diurnal] or [Nocturnal], but instead is mostly awake during the transitional periods between the two.

name: Crimson Song
effects:
When this character sings, they cause people around them to grow increasingly angry and bloodthirsty. The effect is broken when they stop singing. 
Cooldown: Once daily

name: Critical Number
effects:
This character has a lucky attack that activates when they connect a certain number of hits. This lucky attack is the absolute best attack that can be dealt to an enemy and is usually results in critical damage or death to the recipient. Once it reaches that number, the number of hits reset. This number is determined by a d10 + 9.
Cooldown: Any time the number of hits is equal to the rolled critical number.

name: Crocodile Tears
effects: This character is very good at acting weak, saddened or helpless for attention. Other characters are less likely to be angry with this character when they put on a show, and may be able to manipulate others into doing what they want if they shed some tears.

name: Crybaby
effects: If this character is put under stressful situations they may break down crying and become useless for the duration of their panicking.

name: Cryptic
effects:
This character speaks in riddles, code, and tends to be extremely hidden about their words. Due to this it's extremely hard for people around them to understand what they are trying to say. This character might be so dedicated to their riddles that they are willing to endanger others with their unwillingness to stop.
Ex: This character knows about a monster coming up, this character will tell the people who are heading towards the monster a riddle about how there is a monster in the next room without saying directly there is a monster and they need to prepare for it.

name: Cultist
effects: This character believes in the strange, the arcane, the other. They are naturally drawn to fringe cults and strange beliefs, and may already be a member of several of these groups.

name: Cunning
effects: This character is crafty when it comes to lying and deception, able to more easily trick others to get what they want.

name: Curious
effects: This character has a general thirst for knowledge and tends to ask a lot of questions. They are more likely to investigate anything that seems out of the ordinary.

name: Currency control
effects:
This character can control the worthless paper money from the speddaris' homeworld. They do not have control over any other kind of currency.
Restrictions: This trait is restricted to speddaris, no other species can have this trait.

name: Cute
effects: Aww, well aren't you just precious! People are easily endeared to this character with their puppy-like look. Their presence is often additionally capable of increasing morale for the crew, assuming they like sweet things.

name: Cyborg
effects: This character is part mechanical and organic but is not a clockwork or anomaly.

name: Cynical
effects: This character is slow to trust others and may not understand sincerity or integrity, believing that people must be motivated by self-interest. They may disobey orders or go against their own crew because they believe they are trying to trick them.

name: DO PANIC
effects: This character is easily stressed and prone to panicking in situations that become too much for them. Depending on the type of character they may shut down, become aggressive, break down, act irrational, or become lost and flighty. It may get so bad that panicking becomes the norm for this character.

name: DON'T PANIC
effects: When situations come at this character, they remain calm and collected. They are able to think clearly in nearly all situations.

name: Daily offerings
effects:
This character uses up a particular resource daily, and will suffer morale losses if unable to do so. Completing this ritual increases morale and sanity by a small amount.
Restrictions: Can be applied to any species, but recommended to balance inorganic species/species who would otherwise not consume rations.

name: Dandy
effects:
“That's a wrap, folks!”
Cooldown: Whenever the character does something life changing for themself that finishes up a “plotline”.

name: Daredevil
effects: This character actively attempts to do dangerous stunts. When they see a fire, they run into it to try and save people, even though they are totally untrained. They weighed the pros and cons, and are FULLY aware of the danger they're putting themselves through. This puts them in the line of danger far more often.

name: Data Lost
effects:
“Its almost like you never existed in the first place.....”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Day Dreamer
effects: This character tends to be lost in thought most of the time. This doesn't mean they always don't pay attention to things but just are capable of thinking of multiple things at once. Sometimes they really don't pay attention though.

name: Dazzling Beauty
effects:
This character can emit a twinkling cloud of raw attractiveness. This is useless as a light source, but accentuates the character's beauty and temporarily boosts their charisma by 1d10 for a single encounter.
Cooldown: Once per day.

name: Dead
effects: This character is dead. There isnt much more to explain here. No longer alive. Passed away. This character, in most cases, can no longer be used while this trait is active. Some things might be able to fix this, but not many.

name: Deaf
effects: This character has a hard time hearing, or is absolutely deaf. This character may miss many statements made by others or outright not be able to hear anyone.

name: Death Grip
effects: This character has a bonus +5 to miracle rolls and can remain standing even after a stunning attack or a particularly devastating blow.

name: Death Wish
effects: This character is walking hand-in-hand with death wherever they go. Circumstances will twist themselves to ensure that this character will be forced to make a life-and-death roll at least once per planet, regardless of situation or other effects.

name: Debate Me!
effects: This character is more likely to have verbal arguments with everyone around them, including crewmates.

name: Debbie Downer
effects: The glass is always half empty for this character. This character looks at the negative side of just about everything. This character tends to voice, or at least allude to their pessimistic thoughts. This action can erode morale over time and in rare cases even cause others to gain [Pessimistic]. Sometimes goes hand in hand with [Despondent].

name: Deceased
effects: This character is dead. There isnt much more to explain here. No longer alive. Passed away. This character, in most cases, can no longer be used while this trait is active. Some things might be able to fix this, but not many.

name: Deceptive
effects: This character is crafty when it comes to lying and deception, able to more easily trick others to get what they want.

name: Dedicated
effects: This character is commonly hard-working and is unlikely to fail most of their tasks. This character is also careful with their work and makes less mistakes than most.

name: Deep Diver
effects: Unusual for their species, this character is incredibly good at swimming, and can stay underwater for hours at a time, if not indefinitely. They might possess fins, webbing, or even gills that allow them to breathe underwater.

name: Defeatism
effects: Characters with this trait is almost always ready to give up on something, whether it be as simple as throwing the garbage out or something as complex as winning a battle. They have a tendency of having quite a depressing outlook on situations and can make others, including themselves, lose moral quite quickly. Characters with this trait would also not care if people they know end up dying if they're not that close to them. Quite commonly claiming 'It'll happen eventually' as a response.

name: Defensive
effects: This character may get very upset or angry if they are challenged in some way, typically when their competence at certain tasks is called into question.

name: Deflector
effects: This character absolutely refuses to accept the blame for anything, no matter how severe or how responsible they were for an incident. Every time this happens the crews sanity and morale slightly decreases.

name: Deja Vu
effects: This character ends up in the same situation often. This is not a time loop but just an odd event.

name: Denial
effects: This character refuses to embrace a certain fact, something that has happened or will happen and will do anything to dance around the issue and pretend it is fine. This can be incredibly stressful for their crewmates as well as themselves leading to a decline in sanity and morale.

name: Dependent
effects: This character is dependent on a person, object, or action. This character commonly will become distressed if what they are dependent on leaves or stops. This character might become useless and be unwilling to work once they reach this state.

name: Depressed
effects: This character generally feels down or sad; while this character can definitely have times where they are joyful or feeling well, sometimes tiny things can prompt their mood into a harsh drop.

name: Desensitized
effects: This character is emotionally distant. This could be natural or a defense mechanism, but either way, they come off as cold, uncaring, and unaffected. They treat serious situations with a clear detachment that makes others feel like they're not being heard.

name: Deserter
effects: This character will always try to back down from a fight, though they will still act in self-defense if they don't have a choice. If forced into dangerous situations, they will suffer morale loss, and will be more inclined than most to abandon their crewmates.

name: Despondent
effects: This character generally feels down or sad; while this character can definitely have times where they are joyful or feeling well, sometimes tiny things can prompt their mood into a harsh drop.

name: Destiny
effects:
“You can't fight it”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Destructive
effects: Whether intentionally or not, this character has a habit of breaking whatever they get their hands on. They may be inclined to act out their aggression on inanimate objects and their surroundings.

name: Determination
effects: This character doesn't lose morale as fast and commonly is passionate about what is being done. They will find a way to figure things out in even the toughest of situations. They cannot hit lower than 0 morale.

name: Determined
effects: This character doesn't lose morale as fast and commonly is passionate about what is being done. They will find a way to figure things out in even the toughest of situations. They cannot hit lower than 0 morale.

name: Detrivore
effects: This character takes no penalties from eating rotten or rancid rations. In fact, it's good for them.

name: Devoted
effects: This character is loyal to whoever they are aligned with and it would take a lot to ever drag them away from that.

name: Differently Abled
effects: This character may have some form of what most call a disability. It doesn't interfere as much with daily life as you'd expect, and they chose not to have a prosthetic (if applicable) for whatever reasons they may choose.
otherVersions: This trait comes under many names depending on the situation.

name: Difficulty Sleeping
effects: This character has intense difficulty falling asleep. They may lay awake for hours or skip sleep altogether, leaving them exhausted in the morning. Though this means they can keep watch for others, they aren't likely to be alert and may miss obvious details.

name: Diligent
effects: This character is commonly hard-working and is unlikely to fail most of their tasks. This character is also careful with their work and makes less mistakes than most.

name: Direct
effects: This character is to the point with most things they say. Other characters appreciate this and do not lose sanity when speaking to this character no matter what is being spoken about, unless the other character has a trait that causes them to panic. Conversations with this character tend to be short.

name: Direct with Statements
effects: This character is to the point with most things they say. Other characters appreciate this and do not lose sanity when speaking to this character no matter what is being spoken about, unless the other character has a trait that causes them to panic. Conversations with this character tend to be short.

name: Dirty Laundry
effects:
This character can damage the reputation of a target by revealing information about them to others. Whether at information is true or not won't matter, as the audience won't be able to see the target the same anymore.
Cooldown: Twice per day, but only once per person.

name: Dirty Memer
effects: This character makes references to memes and will mention them constantly. This character is very big on inside jokes as well which are similar to memes.

name: Discerning
effects: This character notices things far quicker than most other types of characters. They are more likely to make observations about hidden passageways or certain special objects. They overall make better judgements than others.

name: Disciplined
effects: This character has a certain behavior or way of working. This behavior is usually helpful to their group and commonly promotes teamwork. This character is less likely to disobey commands, is less likely to lose sanity and will likely follow routine.

name: Disdainful
effects: It doesn't take much for this character's opinion of another to begin souring. When someone does something that violates this character's sense of propriety, whether it be their habit of littering, moronic thoughts, or foul mouth, it all adds up to get on their last nerve.

name: Diseased
effects: This trait is a very general trait relating to any unknown or hidden diseases the character has picked up. When the disease is found out the name of the trait changes into that sickness.

name: Dishonorable
effects: This character doesn't believe in playing fair. If they see an opportunity to rig the odds in their favor, they will take advantage of it. This can land them in deep trouble if they get caught.

name: Dislikes X
effects: This character dislikes X, but can tolerate being around it for a little while.

name: Disloyal
effects: When given the chance, this character may rebel against anyone who is higher up. They are more likely to lose morale when they do not get what they want or when they feel a higher up is going against them, even if the situation was justified.

name: Disorganized
effects: This character has trouble keeping things in order, and will often place things in obscure or hopelessly out-of-order areas. If this character has been trusted to keep an important item with them, it is likely that the item will never be found again.

name: Disrespect Your Surroundings
effects: Whether intentionally or not, this character has a habit of breaking whatever they get their hands on. They may be inclined to act out their aggression on inanimate objects and their surroundings.

name: Disrespectful
effects: This character cares very little about issues relating to anyone but them. They may make very insensitive comments towards people and voice how much they wish other characters would "get over it."

name: Dissociative Amnesia
effects: This character is prone to losing chunks of time and has no memories of anything that happened during certain periods of their life. At the start of every day, a d20 will roll to see if they will be able to recall any events that occurred that day. Sanity will affect the roll.

name: Distraction
effects:
Look here! When activated this character causes everyone not on their team to look at them, and if attacking they will aim their next attacks towards this person. This trait may even affect non-violent situations, such as attracting the attention of everyone as a distraction or grabbing the attention of people in an argument. 
Cooldown: Three times a day.

name: Distrusting
effects: This character is slow to trust others and may not understand sincerity or integrity, believing that people must be motivated by self-interest. They may disobey orders or go against their own crew because they believe they are trying to trick them.

name: Disturbing Smile
effects: Whenever this character has a high morale, any person near them will lose sanity. The more morale they have, the greater the decrease is sanity to others.

name: Diurnal
effects:
This character is typically awake during the day, and sleeps during the night.
Restrictions: Cannot have the traits [Nocturnal] or [Crepescular]

name: Do I know you?
effects:
“Not everybody's special.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Do Not Touch
effects: This character has some sort of natural or built-in protective feature such as quills, spikes, exposed electricity, etc. that result in damage to those who touch that part of them without proper precaution. This feature can be temporarily (or permanently) lost based on overuse or deliberate removal.

name: Do you remember me?
effects:
A character may wipe the (usually short term) memories of those in the nearby or immediate area. Line of sight may be required. 
Cooldown: Once per day.
Restrictions: May only affect organics.

name: Does not need a translator
effects:
This character can translate what a person is saying even without hearing the language before.
Restrictions: This trait is an aftik-only trait.

name: Doesn't know when to give up
effects: This character is too confident in their abilities and is not realistic about how dangerous or challenging something may be. They may take on tasks they cannot do, or put themselves or their team in dangerous situations because they think they can handle it.
otherVersions: Doesn't know when to give up

name: Dominant
effects: This character is a natural-born leader. Crewmates and strangers alike will feel compelled to follow their command, even if they are otherwise unwilling to work together.

name: Doomed
effects: This character is walking hand-in-hand with death wherever they go. Circumstances will twist themselves to ensure that this character will be forced to make a life-and-death roll at least once per planet, regardless of situation or other effects.

name: Down to Earth
effects: This character is very down to earth about things and sees the universe as it is. They're not going to sugar coat it but they're not going to feel bad about it either. This character does not allow their judgement about situations be clouded by emotions. If they had the choice to save a single loved one and 100 people they would pick the latter.

name: Drug Tolerance
effects: This character's body is able to filter substances extremely well. All substances, recreational, medicinal, and lethal, will need to be administered in a larger quantity for them to take any effect. There may be a few exceptions.

name: Drug-resistant
effects: This character's body is able to filter substances extremely well. All substances, recreational, medicinal, and lethal, will need to be administered in a larger quantity for them to take any effect. There may be a few exceptions.

name: Durable
effects:
This character is known for being very durable and hard to break.
Restrictions: A character with this trait may not have their Endurance stat drop below 6.

name: EMP
effects:
This character is capable of generating electromagnetic pulses to disable, damage or destroy equipment, robots, or those otherwise susceptible to an electromagnetic pulse. Whether as part of their body or being trained to use these, the character is not susceptible to their own EMPs.
Cooldown: Twice per day.

name: Eardrum Bane
effects:
This character can sing to pitches high enough to cause damage to things around them. Their voice can break through glass and pierce eardrums, causing deafness and even stunning people. How long they can hold depends on their END. If they exceed the time, they will break their vocal cord and they will not be able to speak and they will lose any voice related traits.
Cooldown: Once per day

name: Earwig
effects: This character is particularly inclined to listen in on conversations that they really aren't supposed to be a part of. This can often impart valuable information, but it can also destroy relationships if they get caught.

name: Easily Agitated
effects: This character is easily agitated and if not given space they can burst into pure anger or even completely shut down and give up.

name: Easily Controlled
effects: This character rarely has any thoughts for themselves. They live for others or a master and commonly will do nothing unless directly ordered to. When this character loses their master or puppeteer they may become helpless or cling to the nearest leader.

name: Easily Frustrated
effects: This character is easily agitated and if not given space they can burst into pure anger or even completely shut down and give up.

name: Easily Sick
effects: This character seems to have no way of keeping diseases out of their body and will spontaneously catch new ailments with various disadvantages.

name: Easily Startled
effects: This character is easily scared by various things such as loud noises, bright lights, or even their own thoughts about what might be up ahead. Not only does this character lose morale and sanity faster then most, they'll likely freeze up when a startling event happens.

name: Easily Stressed
effects: This character is easily overworked or overstressed. They can be prone to emotional breakdowns or other events depending on how they cope.

name: Easily distracted
effects: This character has issues keeping their attention on something. They will commonly lose concentration and become unable to get it back.

name: Easily scared
effects: This character is easily scared by various things such as loud noises, bright lights, or even their own thoughts about what might be up ahead. Not only does this character lose morale and sanity faster then most, they'll likely freeze up when a startling event happens.

name: Easy Pickings
effects: This character is viewed as a easy target, whether or not it is true. Enemies will attack them first, and this character is more likely to be attacked when alone.

name: Easy Target
effects: This character is viewed as a easy target, whether or not it is true. Enemies will attack them first, and this character is more likely to be attacked when alone.

name: Eau de Stank
effects: This character's Charisma score is lowered to 1 for all who can smell the repulsive odor wafting from their various, unwashed pores. Gross.

name: Eavesdropper
effects: This character is particularly inclined to listen in on conversations that they really aren't supposed to be a part of. This can often impart valuable information, but it can also destroy relationships if they get caught.

name: Educated about X
effects: This character knows a lot of info about X. This does not mean that this character can do things relating to X, only that they know the ins and outs of X.

name: Efficient
effects: This character is commonly hard-working and is unlikely to fail most of their tasks. This character is also careful with their work and makes less mistakes than most.

name: Efficient
effects: This character good at making the most of the supplies they are given, using less resources than would normally be needed to complete their work.

name: Egg
effects:
“Waiting to be hatched...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Egotistical
effects: Often going hand in hand with [Narcissist], this character believes that they are so far above everyone else, they would need a periscope just to look them in the eyes. Their treatment towards others reflects this.

name: Electro-Magnetic Pulse
effects:
This character is capable of generating electromagnetic pulses to disable, damage or destroy equipment, robots, or those otherwise susceptible to an electromagnetic pulse. Whether as part of their body or being trained to use these, the character is not susceptible to their own EMPs.
Cooldown: Twice per day.

name: Elephant Memory
effects: This character has been remembering everything since the very start of their memories. They can recall incredibly fine details from things that happened years ago and they can almost instantly memorize anything they see or witness.

name: Eloquent
effects: This character knows just the right words for any situation. Their way with considered impressive but they may confuse people with their fancy pants words.

name: Eloquent Writer
effects: Depending on skill level, this character gets an added +1 to +5 boost to their charisma stat when communicating in a specific medium that they feel more at home in, whether through some form of the written word, online chat/discourse, charades/pantomime, or some other non-standard form of communication that they specialize in. A +1 boost would be someone who is well-trained in that medium, while a +5 is a one-in-a-million talent whose skill level has likely required some sort of significant trade-off to achieve.

name: Emergency Aid
effects:
When a character fails a miracle roll, this character can allow them to make a second miracle roll to stay alive.
Cooldown: Once per day

name: Emergency Conscript
effects: If a non-military or military emergency is declared nearby by an authority with jurisdiction over an organization this character belongs to, this character will be notified with a call to serve a duty. They can choose to accept or else they may face consequences for failing to serve. [Emergency Conscript] means the character only can be called for non-military emergencies; [Military Reserve] means the character only serves military emergencies. The range for emergencies the character can be called to depends upon the severity level of the emergency: for instance, a fire may only trigger reserve-conscripts within an hour's travel time; a rare event like a star forecast to go supernova may call upon all conscripts within two warps.

name: Emergency Repairs
effects:
When a character fails a miracle roll, this character can allow them to make a second miracle roll to stay alive.
Cooldown: Once per day

name: Emotional Dysregulation
effects: This character has trouble with processing, reacting to or controlling their emotions in ways other characters might typically expect. The character's hypersensitivity or hyperreactivity to emotional situations may result in their avoidance of such situations or relationships. Likewise, other characters may be put off by how intense or unpredictable they find the character.

name: Emotional Overload
effects: This character has the good days and hellish days. They experience feelings more intensely than anyone, to the point of taking physical damage and incapacitating them. Any negative emotions this character feels, will damage them and, depending on the severity of the situation, will render them immobile or frozen. Although, any more positive emotions may have the opposite effect.

name: Empathetic
effects: This character is not only considerate of others, but is also very understanding of other's issues. This person is good at seeing things from other's points of view and seeing how people's issues would make them feel. Others may want to talk to this character about their problems as they will understand, and may feel bad for them and try to comfort them. However, their sensitive side means it may be easier to hurt this character's feelings.

name: Empowering
effects: This character passively causes other characters to get more excited, awake and emotional when nearby. This may increase the morale of those nearby and make them be more confident. This will only work for organic people, while Empowering will only work for mechanical people.  This trait is the opposite of [Calming Presence].

name: End it quick
effects:
When this character attempts to kill another character they have a 1 in 20 chance of instantly killing the other character. If they fail they will be unable to attack their chosen victim for the rest of the day.
