effects: This character is very quiet in their tone of voice. If they want to whisper, then they can with ease. Although others might find it really hard to understand what this character is saying, others might find their tone rather calming.

name: Shifty
effects: Something about this character seems off, whether it's the look in their eyes to how they move around, they give off an untrustworthy aura. Other characters are more prone to doubt and accuse this character if anything suspicious or bad were to happen, regardless of whether they did it or not.

name: Ship Sickness
effects: This character may fair well on a steady spaceship, but during takeoff, rapid vehicle rides, or bumpy ship conditions they may not be able to hold in their stomach contents or concentrate on their job.

name: Shocking
effects: This character has some sort of natural or built-in protective feature such as quills, spikes, exposed electricity, etc. that result in damage to those who touch that part of them without proper precaution. This feature can be temporarily (or permanently) lost based on overuse or deliberate removal.

name: Shopaholic
effects: This character has a tendency to spend a lot of money on one item or spend a lot of money on several items, whether or not they may be useful. They may also be liable to go on a shopping spree. Characters affected by this trait tend to have a morale boost after shopping before sharply declining as they end up regretting their actions. To cheer themself up, they might shop a little more.

name: Short
effects: This creature is shorter than average for their species.

name: Short Fuse
effects: Although a character with this trait might be normally friendly, it does not take much to provoke them. If you prod at or question their beliefs, ideas, or otherwise challenge them, be prepared for them to lash out. A character with this trait can have trouble taking criticism well.

name: Short attention span
effects: This character has issues keeping their attention on something. They will commonly lose concentration and become unable to get it back.

name: Short life
effects: This character will live a shorter life than the average member of their species. This may be due to genetics, lifestyle choices, or other factors, but ultimately it means they're dying as sooner than others.

name: Show Me the Money
effects: When it comes to selling things, this character knows just what to say to make quite the convincing sales pitch. Items sold by this character are likely able to fetch a hefty sum.

name: Show Pony
effects: This character can carry -3 less than what their stats would normally allow.

name: Show-off
effects: This character boasts about their skills, and often want people to watch them do things to show off how good they are at it.

name: Shrinking Violet
effects:
When active, this trait causes this character's charisma to drop to 1.
Restrictions: For use with controller traits such as [Moodmeter].

name: Shut up already
effects:
This character is capable of rendering another character unable to speak for a short amount of time. 
Cooldown: Can be used thrice a day. 
Restrictions: Only allowed on characters with psychic powers. Only works on organics.

name: Shy
effects: This character may not talk much, may talk quietly, or be nervous around unfamiliar people.

name: Sick
effects: This trait is a very general trait relating to any unknown or hidden diseases the character has picked up. When the disease is found out the name of the trait changes into that sickness.

name: Sickness Spreader
effects: This character is a carrier of many illnesses even if they themself are not affected by any. Time to time, someone around them might gain a sickness or mutation simply from being close to this character.

name: Simple
effects: This character leads an humble lifestyle and doesn't concern themselves with luxury and elegance. Characters with this trait may dislike working with hi-tech equipment, or fancy tools.

name: Sincere
effects: This character cannot bring themselves to mislead others, and will try not to keep secrets from fellow crew. Most will appreciate their honesty, but it can anger others or even land them in trouble if they aren't careful.

name: Singer
effects: This trait is similar to [Artist], however, a character with this trait specializes in musical talent rather than creating visual art.

name: Single Response
effects: This character tends to have one response for all questions.

name: Single-minded
effects: This character is commonly stuck in their ways and is unwilling to change their thoughts on matters. This character is likely to believe what they think is the best option and what everyone else should believe.

name: Sir/Madame X-ington
effects:
“Even suggesting that this character is an X is preposterous.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Sitcom
effects:
“You are the star of the show! Maybe. The audience likes you anyway. You think?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Sixth Sense
effects: This character has a unnatural sense for potential danger. They will be able to sense when something will hit them or drop on them and have some time to react.

name: Sketchy
effects: Something about this character seems off, whether it's the look in their eyes to how they move around, they give off an untrustworthy aura. Other characters are more prone to doubt and accuse this character if anything suspicious or bad were to happen, regardless of whether they did it or not.

name: Skilled at X
effects: This character is very skilled in X, and they are better at it than the average Joe. This character has likely had X as a job before and knows the ins and outs of X.

name: Sleeper Shopkeep
effects:
Ignoring all caps, this character's Strength, Endurance, and Agility stats are doubled for a few minutes if they catch someone stealing from them.
Cooldown: Unlimited
Restrictions: This trait is for shopkeepers only.

name: Sleeptalks
effects: This character frequently talks in their sleep.

name: Sleepwalks
effects: This character normally sleepwalks. They may be able to perform daily tasks with the same ease, carry on lucid conversations, be easily suggestible, or none of the above.

name: Slots Magnet
effects: This character is a natural born gambler. They will gladly gamble away some of their credits on any game of luck.

name: Slow
effects:
This character moves very slowly and takes their sweet time getting anywhere.
Restrictions: Agility cannot go above 3 points.

name: Slowpoke
effects:
This character moves very slowly and takes their sweet time getting anywhere.
Restrictions: Agility cannot go above 3 points.

name: Sluggish
effects:
When this trait is active, this character's agility is 1.
Restrictions: This trait can only be used with an Activator trait, such as [Moodmeter].

name: Small Eater
effects: This character consumes half the normal amount of rations.

name: Smells Good
effects:
This character, whether it be by natural means or a cologne/perfume, has a scent that is appealing other to people. If the other characters(s) can smell this odor, this character will gain a slight boost in charisma.
Restrictions: This trait will not activate if the other party does not have any type of scent glands to smell this character with or does not have an adequately developed sense of smell.
otherVersions: Come Get a Whiff of This!

name: Smelly
effects: This character's Charisma score is lowered to 1 for all who can smell the repulsive odor wafting from their various, unwashed pores. Gross.

name: Smitten
effects: This character forms crushes on other characters very easily, whether it be one or many people they've fallen for. How receptive these people are to this character's crush however, is variable.

name: Snake Eyes
effects: All skill checks for this character must also pass an additional luck check.

name: Sneaky
effects: This character is skilled at performing tasks without being seen or heard. They are good at avoiding detection and are much less likely to be caught doing things without permission.

name: Snob
effects: This person often thinks they are higher than other people in someway, such as intellectually, psychically, monetary, or otherwise. They will often flaunt this fact in someway, such as giving goods, or just loudly proclaiming it whenever a "lesser" is failing at a task they could do. Many do not actually mean to offend, and believe they're doing a friendly gesture or making an observation without realizing the annoyance of the other party.

name: Snoop
effects: This character is particularly inclined to listen in on conversations that they really aren't supposed to be a part of. This can often impart valuable information, but it can also destroy relationships if they get caught.

name: Social
effects: This character is more likely to start conversations with others and bring people together. If a character wishes to speak to someone in a group this character is in, this character will likely be the first one they go to.

name: Social Butterfly
effects: This character is more likely to start conversations with others and bring people together. If a character wishes to speak to someone in a group this character is in, this character will likely be the first one they go to.

name: Social Escape
effects: If a situation becomes too stressful for this character, they will impulsively attempt to escape it through whatever means possible. This usually occurs suddenly and unexpectedly during conversations or other such social events and usually end in negative reactions from the other party.

name: Soft-spoken
effects: This character may not talk much, may talk quietly, or be nervous around unfamiliar people.

name: Softie
effects: This character is easily moved when they see somebody down on their luck. While this character may end up making some friends this way, they will end up helping others even if they can't afford it. This character suffers severe morale losses when made to be mean, but doesn't feel any obligation to be nice to villainous people.

name: Solar Flare
effects:
This character can create an unbearably bright light that will blind any who see it and has the chance to cause permanent blindness, this includes any crew members, enemies, or locals. 
Cooldown: Twice a day.

name: Somnambulist
effects: This character normally sleepwalks. They may be able to perform daily tasks with the same ease, carry on lucid conversations, be easily suggestible, or none of the above.

name: Sonic Screech
effects:
This character can sing to pitches high enough to cause damage to things around them. Their voice can break through glass and pierce eardrums, causing deafness and even stunning people. How long they can hold depends on their END. If they exceed the time, they will break their vocal cord and they will not be able to speak and they will lose any voice related traits.
Cooldown: Once per day

name: Sorry
effects: This character tends to apologize when things go wrong, no matter how minor, or if they even had anything to do with what happened at all. This can get them in trouble, as some may find this annoying, and their apologizing may lead others to assume they did whatever they've apologized for, even if they did not. However, some characters may take pity on this character, and comfort them when they seemingly apologize for no reason.

name: Soul Switchroo
effects:
“Walk a mile in someone else's shoes.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Sound Barrier
effects: This character is immune to the effects of loud noises and enjoys a small speed bonus in deafening environments. This character likely listens to loud music for fun.

name: Sound sensitive
effects: This character is prone to burnout through too much sensory input, be it auditory, tactile, or visual. The reactions may be different, however; shut-downs or aggression in response to overload are common.

name: Space Ripper
effects:
“It just slices and dices.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Speak of the Devil
effects:
“You're right on time!”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Speaks in riddles
effects:
This character speaks in riddles, code, and tends to be extremely hidden about their words. Due to this it's extremely hard for people around them to understand what they are trying to say. This character might be so dedicated to their riddles that they are willing to endanger others with their unwillingness to stop.
Ex: This character knows about a monster coming up, this character will tell the people who are heading towards the monster a riddle about how there is a monster in the next room without saying directly there is a monster and they need to prepare for it.

name: Speaks with a Stutter
effects: This character speaks with a stutter. Despite the fact that it may take them a little longer to speak than most, they tend to not be heavily affected by this.

name: Speaks with an Accent
effects: This character speaks with a certain accent from a certain region or species, a lisp, has a speech abnormality.

name: Speaks with an X accent
effects: This character speaks with a certain accent from a certain region or species, a lisp, has a speech abnormality.

name: Special Eyes
effects:
“I have special eyes...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Special Talent
effects:
“Extremely skilled at X, but as for other tasks...”
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Scretsen-only trait. All scretsens have this by default.

name: Speciesist
effects: This character negatively or positively judges others based on what they were born as and not on the person's actions. This character will commonly review the social standing of a person by their species and race when they see them. This is different from the classist trait as this character does not judge on the character's social standing but the social standing of their entire race. It is possible for a speciesist to see all higher races as scum of the earth and lower species as absolutely perfect.

name: Speechless
effects: This character cannot speak. Even if this character is not very affected by this, other characters can have a hard time comprehending what they mean if they're not good at understanding expressions or hand signals.

name: Speed Demon
effects: While the character may or may not be gifted in terms of agility, they are exceptionally quick with finishing tasks. The quality of the work isn't typically effected by the speed in which they finish a job, but there are cases in where an extra layer of polish could have been helpful.

name: Speedrunner
effects: While the character may or may not be gifted in terms of agility, they are exceptionally quick with finishing tasks. The quality of the work isn't typically effected by the speed in which they finish a job, but there are cases in where an extra layer of polish could have been helpful.

name: Spikes
effects: This character has some sort of natural or built-in protective feature such as quills, spikes, exposed electricity, etc. that result in damage to those who touch that part of them without proper precaution. This feature can be temporarily (or permanently) lost based on overuse or deliberate removal.

name: Spiteful
effects: This character is extremely angry and will do many things out of spite. Some with this trait will try to hide their malice, but it is still there and effective.

name: Spoiled
effects: This character has perhaps been overindulged by their parents or caregivers and has evolved a special kind of attitude because of it. A character with this trait resorts to very immature and often self-centered endeavors in order to get their way. It's common for this character to exhibit temper tantrums or even manipulation.

name: Spontaneously Combustion
effects:
When this character is hit or takes an action which results in severe harm to them, they must roll a miracle roll or spontaneously combust, dealing damage to all creatures and objects around the source.
Restrictions: Must be a robot or have naturally combustible materials.

name: Spoonerism
effects: This character will commonly make mistakes in their speech, typically manifesting in replacing words with other similarly sounding words.

name: Spotlight
effects:
“All that anyone sees...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Spotlight Thief
effects: This character wants attention. They are obsessive over it, and will do anything and everything to get attention from others, whether it's faking injuries, mental conditions, or making up any types of stories about themselves to grab a person's attention. Attention seekers may even tell half truths to spice up their stories to make themselves seem more heroic.

name: Stealthy
effects: This character is skilled at performing tasks without being seen or heard. They are good at avoiding detection and are much less likely to be caught doing things without permission.

name: Stereo-Blind
effects: This character has some sort of major sight problem, it could be due to genetics, injury, or anything else. How bad their sight is can range from fairly bad sight even with corrective eye-ware, all the way to total blindness. This character is more likely to miss visual based cues.

name: Sticky Feet
effects: This character can walk on walls.

name: Sticky Fingers
effects: This character compulsively steals items, even if the character does not have a want or use for the items stolen. This character may hide stolen items for them to turn up later, or simply hoard them all in one big secret location.

name: Stitched up
effects: A character with this trait has lost a few body parts and it has been replaced with that of another person's or species.

name: Stone-Faced
effects: This character shows a lack of expression, or is able to switch from being expressive to having a lack of it. This character can be hard to read for both friends and foe. You may also be unable to see the morale, sanity, and general feelings of this character in the crew logs.

name: Stop, Thief!
effects:
Ignoring all caps, this character's Strength, Endurance, and Agility stats are doubled for a few minutes if they catch someone stealing from them.
Cooldown: Unlimited
Restrictions: This trait is for shopkeepers only.

name: Storm Chaser
effects: This character sees danger or drama and tends to runs towards it to watch it. They weighed the pros and cons, and are FULLY aware of the danger they're putting themselves through. This puts them in the line of danger far more often

name: Storyteller
effects: This character could spend hours telling stories. These stories range from personal life stories, to myths, to even things like gossip.

name: Straightforward
effects: This character is to the point with most things they say. Other characters appreciate this and do not lose sanity when speaking to this character no matter what is being spoken about, unless the other character has a trait that causes them to panic. Conversations with this character tend to be short.

name: Strangely Graceful
effects: This character is graceful, but in a sort of odd way. Many will note that this character has an odd sort of grace, and is frankly sort of mysterious. This causes many other characters to pry more into them.

name: Street Smart
effects: This character knows the streets very well and knows when things are going wrong. This character is also the opposite of gullible and knows all the tricks in the book, and they'll be happy to call it out.

name: Stress Eater
effects: This character eats more rations when they are in a negative mood or under the effects of stressed.

name: Strong Boned
effects:
This character is known for being very durable and hard to break.
Restrictions: A character with this trait may not have their Endurance stat drop below 6.

name: Strong-Willed
effects: This character is resistant to influences of the mental variety, even those that are psychic in nature. They have a strong sense of self-control, and are more capable of fighting back if someone tries to invade their mind or otherwise manipulate them.

name: Strongman
effects:
While this trait is active, Strength is always 10.
Restrictions: This trait can only be used with controlling traits like Moodmeter.

name: Strongman Requiem
effects:
“With power, comes madness.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Stubborn
effects: This character is commonly stuck in their ways and is unwilling to change their thoughts on matters. This character is likely to believe what they think is the best option and what everyone else should believe.

name: Stutterer
effects: This character speaks with a stutter. Despite the fact that it may take them a little longer to speak than most, they tend to not be heavily affected by this.

name: Stutters
effects: This character speaks with a stutter. Despite the fact that it may take them a little longer to speak than most, they tend to not be heavily affected by this.

name: Stylish
effects: This character has an affinity for fashion, and will often have a large wardrobe. They have a tendency to change their clothes often and put together outfits they find appropriate for their situation.

name: Stylish
effects: This character has a sense of fashion and will get a boost in charisma when talking to other characters that like fashion.

name: Suck up
effects: This character likes to stick with people in power and flatter them, or agree with everything they say.

name: Sugar Rush
effects:
Consuming extra rations raises this character's strength and agility by 1 point per ration. After the end of an event, this character crashes, returns to normal stats, then loses 1 point to every stat for the rest of the day.
Cooldown: Once per day.

name: Suggestive Words
effects:
“Do as I say, not as I do.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Supersonic
effects:
When this trait is active, this character's agility is considered 10.
Restrictions: This trait can only be used with an activator trait such as [Moodmeter].

name: Superstitious
effects: This character is more likely to believe in myths, ghosts, and old traditions relating to them. They may have a tradition they follow and may refuse to do certain things that may cause a bad omen to appear, or give them bad luck.

name: Support
effects:
This character can give a helping hand to any character making a check of any ability. This is done as the check is occurring, the character will roll a die half the size of the original and whatever number shows will be added to the roll.
Cooldown: Twice per day

name: Surplus or Bust
effects:
“There is no in between.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Surprise!
effects:
“Oh! Let's see what happens!!!”
Cooldown: Upon Death

name: Sweet Scent
effects:
This character, whether it be by natural means or a cologne/perfume, has a scent that is appealing other to people. If the other characters(s) can smell this odor, this character will gain a slight boost in charisma.
Restrictions: This trait will not activate if the other party does not have any type of scent glands to smell this character with or does not have an adequately developed sense of smell.
otherVersions: Come Get a Whiff of This!

name: Swinger
effects:
“My mood swings with that devil's song.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Symbol of X
effects: This character is the apex citizen/employee/etc. and etc. They're exemplary at what they do, and have a good reputation to boot, so others will typically look to them for guidance. These other characters will emulate the role model's behavior to some degree, causing a contagion of the role model's virtues.

name: Synergy
effects:
This character has a great time working with others. Anytime they work with a specific person they consider a partner, they gain +2 to the task they're working on.
Restrictions: Does not stack with other teamwork buffing traits.

name: Tacky
effects: This character's wardrobe should be considered a war crime. Any apparel this character has will cause them a charisma decrease. Any clothing that is chose by any other characters for them to wear will not have any charisma debuff but will lower their morale the longer they wear it.

name: Tactician
effects: This character is naturally skilled in tactical thinking, and is almost always one step ahead. When in combat, a character with this trait is able to perform special actions and can inform their teammates of the best movements to make.

name: Takes cat naps
effects: Character is neither fully [Diurnal] or [Nocturnal], but instead is mostly awake during the transitional periods between the two.

name: Talkative
effects: This character will talk for ages if allowed and rarely runs out of anything to say.

name: Talky
effects: This character will talk for ages if allowed and rarely runs out of anything to say.

name: Tall
effects: This character is taller than average for their species.

name: Team Oriented
effects: This character does wonderfully in team situations and is always willing to follow plans. This character is almost always ready and willing to help and others rarely feel this character is dragging their feet in a team related operation.

name: Teamwork
effects:
This character has a great time working with others. Anytime they work with a specific person they consider a partner, they gain +2 to the task they're working on.
Restrictions: Does not stack with other teamwork buffing traits.

name: Tech Support Nightmare
effects: Whenever this character interacts with an electronic device of some sort, that device has a very high chance of having a software issue of some kind.

name: Technically Correct
effects:
This character can retry a failed charisma check by providing a logically-airtight explanation why their course of action is the correct one for the listener to take. This second charisma check will add the character's intelligence to the check. Many characters after being beaten by this manner of charisma check will take a dislike to the character and refuse to offer further assistance.
Cooldown: Twice per day.

name: Technically Not Lying
effects: This character is capable of confusing or arguing their case well enough to confuse most people into agreeing. Utilizes intelligence instead of charisma in appropriate situations to boost the chances of convincing the other even when they make little real sense.

name: Tegyp Scheme
effects: This character is trapped in a contract to sell various goods, and has a stock of them they try to sell to anyone they can. They will usually put people off by bringing it up at bad times, or even trying to recruit people under them. This trait is also transferable and can be given to other characters. The selection of goods can be used by the crew but a heavy fee will be deducted from the crews points if they do so. The only upside is if they do sell anything they get points.

name: Telepathic
effects:
This character can speak to other characters using telepathy. This may also mean the character is able to also hear the thoughts of the other people but this is not always the case.
Restrictions: This trait can only be applied to species that have mental powers which allow

name: Telepathy
effects:
This character can speak to other characters using telepathy. This may also mean the character is able to also hear the thoughts of the other people but this is not always the case.
Restrictions: This trait can only be applied to species that have mental powers which allow

name: Telepathy-sensitive
effects: This character has telepathic powers that allow them to hear surface thoughts of those around them, but cannot control or turn off this power. This may prove overwhelming and drown out their own thoughts, or emotionally distressing if people's inner thoughts don't match their outward expression.

name: Telephone
effects:
“Job works at Bob.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Temperaments
effects:
“We're going back to the middle ages!”
Cooldown: This trait is activated when morale is high or low.

name: Territorial
effects: This character has a designated area they call "their territory". They are violently protective of it and are willing to hurt and kill to keep teammates and strangers alike away. If this character were to ever let someone in intentionally, this would possibly mean that they hold great emotion for the guest, or they plan to hurt them.

name: That’s Classified
effects: Secrets or sensitive-information entrusted to this character are kept strictly confidential. The character is resistant to related psychic attacks or data breaches. They cannot willingly divulge this information to others either, unless authorized, even when telling the info would greatly benefit them.

name: The Worst Trait
effects: This character makes references to memes and will mention them constantly. This character is very big on inside jokes as well which are similar to memes.

name: Thick Skin
effects: This character has developed a tolerance for pain, while they can still feel and recognise any pain they may experience it does not break their focus, allowing them to act uninhibited until they choose to address the issue.

name: This trait comes under many names depending on the situation.
effects: This character may have some form of what most call a disability. It doesn't interfere as much with daily life as you'd expect, and they chose not to have a prosthetic (if applicable) for whatever reasons they may choose.
otherVersions: This trait comes under many names depending on the situation.

name: Thought Deluge
effects: This character has telepathic powers that allow them to hear surface thoughts of those around them, but cannot control or turn off this power. This may prove overwhelming and drown out their own thoughts, or emotionally distressing if people's inner thoughts don't match their outward expression.

name: Thought Police
effects:
This character can look over a characters thoughts and steal one idea they have.
Cooldown: Can be used once a day

name: Thrill Seeker
effects:
This character loves danger and has a trait that they gain whenever they are in peril. Every day that this trait goes without activation this character will lose morale. 
Cooldown: Activated whenever this character is scared or in danger.

name: Thrillseeker
effects: This character actively attempts to do dangerous stunts. When they see a fire, they run into it to try and save people, even though they are totally untrained. They weighed the pros and cons, and are FULLY aware of the danger they're putting themselves through. This puts them in the line of danger far more often.

name: Ticking Time Bomb
effects:
When this character is hit or takes an action which results in severe harm to them, they must roll a miracle roll or spontaneously combust, dealing damage to all creatures and objects around the source.
Restrictions: Must be a robot or have naturally combustible materials.

name: Tidy
effects: This character keeps things in order. As long as this character is around, objects are less likely to go to waste or be stolen, and if they do they will be noticed right away.

name: Tight-Lipped
effects: Secrets or sensitive-information entrusted to this character are kept strictly confidential. The character is resistant to related psychic attacks or data breaches. They cannot willingly divulge this information to others either, unless authorized, even when telling the info would greatly benefit them.

name: Timed Hits
effects:
This character is capable of scoring multiple hits in a combo if timed correctly to the beat of background music playing during a fight. Base hits during combat will be less damaging, but well-timed long combos can more than make up for this. 
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Activates when music is playing.

name: Tinfoil Hat
effects: This character is inclined to draw connections between things that aren't really connected. Often these beliefs are related to overarching power structures and are rooted in distrust of those in control. The beliefs can manifest in strange behavior and even social isolation, but it's usually quite difficult to talk the character out of them.

name: Tinkerer
effects: This character likes to open things up and see how they work, and try to make them work better. They have no respect for do not open and No user-servicable parts inside notices, and enjoy making little trinkets and gizmos of little use, just to see the mechanisms go.

name: To the Point
effects: This character is to the point with most things they say. Other characters appreciate this and do not lose sanity when speaking to this character no matter what is being spoken about, unless the other character has a trait that causes them to panic. Conversations with this character tend to be short.

name: Together Forever
effects:
“It's like the whole universe exists just to keep us together”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Tolerant
effects: This character is willing to wait things out or is less affected by aggression. This character tends to be a tad more tolerant of others but not by much, even this character has their limit on what they'll be able to take.

name: Toned
effects: This character has spent their life working on themselves, being naturally muscular looking. This character can break the 10 strength cap and go up to 15.

name: Tongue-Tied
effects:
When active, this trait causes this character's charisma to drop to 1.
Restrictions: For use with controller traits such as [Moodmeter].

name: Too Dumb to Die
effects:
Any time this character is about to die a miracle roll will always be summoned no matter what. When it is summoned (8 - Int) will be added to the roll. 
Cooldown: Passive

name: Too Honest
effects: This person just cannot tell a lie, and if not stopped, will confess things they feel people need to know, especially if it's a bad deed. It is hard to stick around this character without having to listen to them go on about something they feel bad about doing or witnessing, which has a tendency to get other crew mates, friends and foes alike into trouble.

name: Too Hot to Handle
effects: This character has some sort of natural or built-in protective feature such as quills, spikes, exposed electricity, etc. that result in damage to those who touch that part of them without proper precaution. This feature can be temporarily (or permanently) lost based on overuse or deliberate removal.

name: Totally Evil
effects: This character talks up how evil they believe they are, usually framing minor rude or completely neutral actions as dastardly and villainous. They might not be evil or even particularly bad at all.

name: Touch sensitive
effects: This character is prone to burnout through too much sensory input, be it auditory, tactile, or visual. The reactions may be different, however; shut-downs or aggression in response to overload are common.

name: Touchy
effects: This character may get very upset or angry if they are challenged in some way, typically when their competence at certain tasks is called into question.

name: Tough It Out
effects: This character has developed a tolerance for pain, while they can still feel and recognise any pain they may experience it does not break their focus, allowing them to act uninhibited until they choose to address the issue.

name: Trail Guide
effects: This character is resourceful with foraging, hunting, and trading in many sectors, and are likely to share their expertise with crew members.

name: Trained Killer
effects: This character is a disciplined fighter and is skilled in the operation of all manners of combat equipment, weapons, and armours. They have killed before, and will suffer no morale or sanity loss from witnessing death.

name: Trained Soldier
effects: This character is a disciplined fighter and is skilled in the operation of all manners of combat equipment, weapons, and armours. They have killed before, and will suffer no morale or sanity loss from witnessing death.

name: Trait
effects:
Description
Restrictions: Generic Only

name: Transformation
effects:
This character has something they transform into. Either this character is a robot with that function, or a certain event has given this character a transformation. This character can either transform just once, or back and forth between two forms, possibly with major sanity or physical damage.
Cooldown: Depends on the type of transformation, can be daily or even monthly.
Restrictions: Characters are unable to start with this trait unless they're a robot, and trait randomizers cannot roll this trait.

name: Transhumanist
effects:
“You're not an X anymore, huh?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Trendy
effects: This character is supposedly up to speed with all relevant slang that the kids these days use, they will often sprinkle such slang or other hip, pop culture references into their speech, although some of their references may at times be slightly outdated.

name: Trick Room
effects:
Within a certain radius a character with this ability causes any inside to have their stat effectiveness swapped. A stat of 1 acts like it is a 10, and a stat of 10 acts like it is a 1, any stats above 10 or below 1 will act like a 1 or 10. The effect lasts for only a few moments.
Cooldown: This ability may be used twice per day.

name: Trickster
effects: This character can easily perform a wide variety of visual and auditory tricks to confuse and mislead their foes or just host a show. Such as vanishing and producing unseen objects from their person, disappearing behind a sheet, or feigning injury, with little risk of the average person seeing through the proverbial smoke and mirrors.

name: Trivia Master
effects:
When this ability is activated, the user instantly learns one random fact. While these facts are usually trivia about some random species or celebrity, they can rarely be incredibly relevant to the situation and give deeply needed insight. Some of these facts might be things that aren't widely known, or aren't even known at all.
Cooldown: Twice per day.

name: Trouble paying attention
effects: This character has issues keeping their attention on something. They will commonly lose concentration and become unable to get it back.

name: Troubleseeker
effects: This character sees danger or drama and tends to runs towards it to watch it. They weighed the pros and cons, and are FULLY aware of the danger they're putting themselves through. This puts them in the line of danger far more often

name: True Colors
effects:
“Everyone shows their true colors eventually...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: True Pacifist
effects: This character hates violence and will refuse to even fight for their life. This character will suffer a morale loss if they find out their peers fought for any reason. Extreme version of [Pacifist].

name: Try Again
effects:
“That's not my name!”
Cooldown: Upon death

name: Tunnel Vision
effects: This character lacks awareness of their surroundings.

name: Turtle Shell
effects:
When incredibly distressed, this character can go into a state of suspended animation. When in this state, this character can take no damage, but cannot move. This immobilized state lasts at least an hour and at most a day.
Cooldown: Once every other day

name: Twist of Fate
effects:
“Is a second chance always a good thing?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Two Birds, One Stone
effects: For whatever reason, be it due to having telekinetic powers for holding additional weapons, or having several pairs of limbs, this character can attack more than once during their turn while in combat.

name: Typo
effects:
When activated a targeted resource may turn out to be wrongly labelled. A few cans of "Meat" was actually "Plants" all along! A box of "Scrap" was just a box of "Wires".
Cooldown: Twice per day.
Restrictions: Any item this trait is activated on becomes "Actually X", and cannot have this trait used on it again. Rarely the item will be of worse quality than expected.

name: ULM
effects: This character is trapped in a contract to sell various goods, and has a stock of them they try to sell to anyone they can. They will usually put people off by bringing it up at bad times, or even trying to recruit people under them. This trait is also transferable and can be given to other characters. The selection of goods can be used by the crew but a heavy fee will be deducted from the crews points if they do so. The only upside is if they do sell anything they get points.

name: Ultimate Acrobat
effects: This character can fit themselves into small spaces and are quick on their feet. This character's agility stat goes beyond the 10 rule.

name: Ultimate Jester
effects:
“"Haha! Such a funny comedian you are!"”
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Does not apply to writing or sign language.

name: Unbreakable
effects:
This character is known for being very durable and hard to break.
Restrictions: A character with this trait may not have their Endurance stat drop below 6.

name: Uncanny Valley
effects: This character has an offputting mannerism like an odd laugh or smile that causes their charisma to drop to 1 when interacting with anyone who experienced it unexpectedly. Lasts anywhere from a turn after the last point of experience up to a day, depending on how well the other person handles it.

name: Uncaring
effects: This character cares very little about issues relating to anyone but them. They may make very insensitive comments towards people and voice how much they wish other characters would "get over it."

name: Uncontrollable Bloodthirst
effects:
This character is extremely volatile, if they detect an open wound they will enter a bloodfrenzy and attack the individual until either the victim or the character is dead, or the character is forcibly restrained. Outside bloodfrenzy, this character is extremely fond of violence, the more gruesome the better, and constantly seek the smallest bit of justification to attack anything that bleeds or can feel pain.
Restrictions: If matched with [Irredeemable] the character loses all blue and green traits, gains 2 more red traits, but gains 10 stat points. If alone it gets rid of one blue and green trait and gives 4 stat points.

name: Uncontrollable Mouth
effects: This character cannot always control what they say and will sometimes say rude or hurtful things without meaning it. They may also agree to things they do not want to do or deny what they wish to do. This trait can cause distress to the character, people around them or both.

name: Underhanded
effects: This character doesn't believe in playing fair. If they see an opportunity to rig the odds in their favor, they will take advantage of it. This can land them in deep trouble if they get caught.

name: Underweight
effects: This character, whether through genetics, undereating, or otherwise, weights a lot less than an individual of their species should be. When doing physical activity, this character will tire much quicker than others. This trait only applies if the character's weight affects them negatively.

name: Undexterous
effects:
When this trait is active, this character's agility is 1.
Restrictions: This trait can only be used with an Activator trait, such as [Moodmeter].

name: Unfashionable
effects: This character has no sense of fashion or style. They are completely unaware of how bad their fashion.

name: Unfocused
effects: This character has issues keeping their attention on something. They will commonly lose concentration and become unable to get it back.

name: Unforgiving
effects: This character very easily holds a grudge and almost never forgives. If this character feels that they have been wronged, they will seek out revenge. It's very difficult for others to work with this character once they have a grudge.

name: Unintelligible Accent
effects: An advanced form of [Speaks with an Accent]. This particular accent is strong enough to make understanding or translating difficult.

name: Unintentionally shifty
effects: However this character communicates, others will tend to assume they're lying, attempting to mislead, or their words cannot otherwise be trusted.

name: Uninteresting
effects: This character is just boring to be honest. Nothing to see here. Most people will lose sanity just hearing them drone about a subject.

name: Universal Amnesia
effects:
“That's not quite how I remember it...”
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Applies to characters that are inconspicuous or forgetful (ex. [Scatterbrained], [Forgettable], [Forgetful]).

name: Universal Believer
effects: This character believes in the strange, the arcane, the other. They are naturally drawn to fringe cults and strange beliefs, and may already be a member of several of these groups.

name: Universal Level Marketing
effects: This character is trapped in a contract to sell various goods, and has a stock of them they try to sell to anyone they can. They will usually put people off by bringing it up at bad times, or even trying to recruit people under them. This trait is also transferable and can be given to other characters. The selection of goods can be used by the crew but a heavy fee will be deducted from the crews points if they do so. The only upside is if they do sell anything they get points.

name: Unlikely Exploit
effects:
When this character would face an impossible skill check where the result of failure (barring a miracle roll) is death, this skill will activate. The character will through some series of contrivances succeed on the check, avoiding death in the process.
Cooldown: The ability may activate at any time provided the conditions are met, but the character may escape death only once using this skill.
Restrictions: Only activates when the character is alone, with no other characters in the vicinity. The character survives/escapes/succeeds the impossible, but nobody will ever believe how they managed it.

name: Unlocking Master
effects: If given enough time, this character can crack open just about any lock that hinders their progress. Does not extend to locks that require special key items.

name: Unlucky Number
effects:
This character has been cursed by a number. If this character rolls the number, or part of the number that the character is cursed by, the roll will automatically fails as if it were the lowest roll possible. If they see the number or it is involved in any aspect of their life, they will feel dread as if something terrible is about to happen.
Restrictions: If the unlucky number is higher than 20, then the first two digits, or just the first digit is used to trigger a failing roll. For example if the unlucky number is 1485, then 14 will trigger a failing roll, but if the number is 9456 then 9 will trigger the failing roll as 94 is higher than 20.

name: Unmiraculous
effects: This character's fate is sealed. They will never receive a miracle roll, and they simply die instead.

name: Unnatural Weapon
effects:
This character was born with weapons, or has fused weapons with their flesh.
Restrictions: This trait is for clockworks only. Any other weapon that is attached to a character is considered an item.

name: Unnerving
effects: This character commonly puts anyone around them on edge by presence alone. Everyday they are with someone, the sanity of the person goes slightly down.

name: Unnoticed
effects: This character is oftentimes forgotten by others or overlooked. When being attacked in a group this character will be the last one to be attacked.

name: Unpredictable
effects: This character's motivations, actions and thoughts are near impossible to discern and predict, especially by those who are unfamiliar with their tendencies.

name: Unreadable
effects: This character shows a lack of expression, or is able to switch from being expressive to having a lack of it. This character can be hard to read for both friends and foe. You may also be unable to see the morale, sanity, and general feelings of this character in the crew logs.

name: Unsettling
effects: This character commonly puts anyone around them on edge by presence alone. Everyday they are with someone, the sanity of the person goes slightly down.

name: Unstable
effects: This character automatically loses sanity each day and loses sanity and morale more quickly than other characters as well. This character most likely needs therapy to function normally.

name: Unstable Matter
effects:
“I think we should put this one back in the test tube, Larry.”
Cooldown:

name: Untasteful
effects: This character's wardrobe should be considered a war crime. Any apparel this character has will cause them a charisma decrease. Any clothing that is chose by any other characters for them to wear will not have any charisma debuff but will lower their morale the longer they wear it.

name: Untrusting
effects: This character is slow to trust others and may not understand sincerity or integrity, believing that people must be motivated by self-interest. They may disobey orders or go against their own crew because they believe they are trying to trick them.

name: Upbeat
effects: This character doesn't lose morale as fast and can never hit negative morale. No matter what the situation, this character will keep their head up high and may raise the morale of others. The optimistic trait may drain sanity if the character is in a bad situation for a long amount of time.

name: Vapors
effects: This character will faint during stressful situations, much to their inconvenience.

name: Variety
effects:
“'Tis the spice of life, no?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Vendetta
effects: This character has been seriously wronged by another character or group and wishes to get revenge. Upon meeting the person this character has a vendetta against, this character will attack them with the intent to kill, no matter how prepared they are for such a fight.

name: Vengeful Strike
effects:
This character has a pension for revenge, being able to give pain dealt to them back at the attackers. When this character is hurt by an attack, they can hit the attacker for [1d3] times the damage that was dealt by the attacker, only to the attacker.
Cooldown: Twice per day

name: Ventriloquism
effects:
This character can throw their voice. Others will hear the voice come from the direction of the speaker's choosing.
Restrictions: The character must be capable of speaking or imitating some sort of noise.

name: Verdant Song
effects:
When this character sings, they cause people around them to become calm and relaxed. The effect is broken once they stop singing.
Cooldown: Once per day.

name: Verminous
effects: This character is harboring an unknown parasite.

name: Very Perceptive
effects: This character notices things far quicker than most other types of characters. They are more likely to make observations about hidden passageways or certain special objects. They overall make better judgements than others.

name: Veto
effects:
Veto allows this character to cancel out an action, and the consequences of that action. Example, if [Veto] is used to cancel out someone firing a gun, the gun will have the same amount of rounds as it would have if it wasn't fired, and the target will be unharmed. Keep in mind that nothing stops them from just shooting again though. 
Cooldown: Twice daily.

name: Vigilant
effects: This character notices things far quicker than most other types of characters. They are more likely to make observations about hidden passageways or certain special objects. They overall make better judgements than others.

name: Violent
effects: This character prefers to let their fist equivalents do the talking. They will regularly threaten others with physical violence, and will happily jump on any opportunity to bring harm upon their enemies or anyone who gets in their way.

name: Vision Impaired
effects: This character has some sort of major sight problem, it could be due to genetics, injury, or anything else. How bad their sight is can range from fairly bad sight even with corrective eye-ware, all the way to total blindness. This character is more likely to miss visual based cues.

name: Visions
effects:
“There's a storm a-comin'.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Vitiligo
effects: This character has the piebaldism equivalent of their species.

name: Voidseer
effects:
“You can't tell the future. But you can make your own.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Volatile Chemistry
effects:
When this character is hit or takes an action which results in severe harm to them, they must roll a miracle roll or spontaneously combust, dealing damage to all creatures and objects around the source.
Restrictions: Must be a robot or have naturally combustible materials.

name: Vulnerable
effects: This character is viewed as a easy target, whether or not it is true. Enemies will attack them first, and this character is more likely to be attacked when alone.

name: Wall Walker
effects: This character can walk on walls.

name: Wanderlust
effects: This character, regardless of orders that may or may not have been given to them, occasionally will leave to do their own thing instead; this affects player-issued commands as well. When this character wanders off, the player will lose control of them and be unable to see what they're up to. The character may gain a slight bonus when it comes to completing the task, though it will take longer to finish than it should. Examples of this could be pausing in paperwork in order to cook a meal then realizing they could finish the paperwork a little more efficiently a certain way, or stopping in tech repairs to take a walk and figuring out how to use 8 wires for something that otherwise would take 10 wires to fix.

name: Wanted
effects: An individual or organization are attempting to track this individual down. This might take the form of a single tracker, or a widespread alert to all law enforcement in civilized space. The character may have to disguise themself to avoid constant entanglements either legal or violent.

name: Watcher
effects:
“Do you ever feel like you're being watched?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Watchful Eye
effects:
“Do you ever feel like you're being watched?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: We meet again
effects:
When activated, this ability will summon a random character the user has met to the scene. This character needn't necessarily be able to help and may make matters worse, intentionally or otherwise.
Cooldown: Useable once a day.
Restrictions: A luck stat of 7 or more.

name: Weak
effects:
When this trait is activated, this character's Strength drops to 1.
Restrictions: This trait can only be used with an Activator trait, such as [Moodmeter].

name: Weaponized Ignorance
effects:
Any time this character is about to die a miracle roll will always be summoned no matter what. When it is summoned (8 - Int) will be added to the roll. 
Cooldown: Passive

name: Weathervane
effects: This character, whether by a naturalist's intuition or years of study, is very good at predicting the weather. They can sense the forecast in a new location just by glancing at the sky or feeling the breeze on their face. Characters with this trait will usually be prepared for all but the most extreme weather patterns.

name: Well Armed
effects:
This character is armed to the teeth and as such is never without a weapon. If you don't equip a weapon to this character and they need to fight, they will pull out a random weapon that they "happened" to have on them that was never mentioned until now. How good the weapon is depends on a roll. 
Cooldown: Once per day.

name: Were-X
effects:
This character has something they transform into. Either this character is a robot with that function, or a certain event has given this character a transformation. This character can either transform just once, or back and forth between two forms, possibly with major sanity or physical damage.
Cooldown: Depends on the type of transformation, can be daily or even monthly.
Restrictions: Characters are unable to start with this trait unless they're a robot, and trait randomizers cannot roll this trait.

name: West Wind
effects:
“That's a wrap, folks!”
Cooldown: Whenever the character does something life changing for themself that finishes up a “plotline”.

name: What was that?
effects: This character's senses are particularly dull and they often miss small details or else need things repeated for them. Their senses may not be bad to the level of deafness, blindness, etc, but they could certainly be a lot better.

name: Wheelmaster
effects: This character is instinctively adept at the control of any vehicle or ridden creature they attempt to pilot or command, able to make maneuvers even when in stressfull situations.

name: Who are you again?
effects:
“Not everybody's special.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Wide skill range
effects: This character knows about a lot and if the situation calls for it they are able to do many things outside of their job title with no formal education on the subject. This character will not be the best at it or particularly good but will be able to do it.

name: Willpower
effects: This character is resistant to influences of the mental variety, even those that are psychic in nature. They have a strong sense of self-control, and are more capable of fighting back if someone tries to invade their mind or otherwise manipulate them.

name: Windup
effects: This character need to be wound up time to time. When they have just been winded up their speed is 10. Slowly, their speed will die down until they can no longer move and they need to be winded up again.

name: Wing it
effects: This character is very good at improvisation, this means they can pull things off without instruction and can make up entire stories on the spot.

name: Wire Frame
effects:
This character is not known for their durability.
Restrictions: A character with this trait may not have their Endurance stat rise above 4.

name: Wiseau
effects: An advanced form of [Speaks with an Accent]. This particular accent is strong enough to make understanding or translating difficult.

name: Wonderball
effects:
“Waiting to be hatched...”
Cooldown: Passive

name: Work Dammit!
effects:
This character can hit a broken machine and unless it is broken beyond repair it will start working for a randomized set of time. Once that time has passed the machine will break down again but may respond to another jab by this character.
Cooldown: Thrice per day.

name: Workaholic
effects: This character is an excessive worker, compelled to stay busy even in their free time. They may become antsy or aimless when bored, impulsively seeking out work when untasked.

name: Works best alone
effects: This character will commonly keep to themselves and gets a slight boost to production while doing so. When in a group this character will get a slight decrease to production.

name: Works well alone
effects: This character will commonly keep to themselves and gets a slight boost to production while doing so. When in a group this character will get a slight decrease to production.

name: Wrathful
effects: This character is extremely angry and will do many things out of spite. Some with this trait will try to hide their malice, but it is still there and effective.

name: X Allergies
effects: This character is allergic to X and has bad reactions when exposed to X. This character may need to take medication to lessen reactions to X and if not done their reaction to X can become fatal.

name: X Camouflage
effects: This character is incredibly hard to see while on a specific (X) type of terrain. When camouflaged they can move around very stealthily.

name: X Do Not Interact
effects:
“Read my about page before you follow :^)”
Cooldown: Passive

name: X Fan
effects: This character enjoys whatever X is. While characters can like anything without having it as a trait, with this trait X is slightly more likely to pop up or be a starting item for the character.

name: X Hunter
effects: This character is experienced in combat with X type of opponent and gains an attack bonus against them. The more specific the typing, the greater the bonus.

name: X Killer
effects: This character is experienced in combat with X type of opponent and gains an attack bonus against them. The more specific the typing, the greater the bonus.

name: X Lady
effects: This character enjoys the company and ownership of a particular fauna very, very much. Now they have too many of them. They likely smell like the fauna, will risk their own well-being to defend any attacked members of that fauna group, and have trouble not taking in any new fauna they see.

name: X Magnet
effects:
“It looks like there's a bit of a theme going on here.”
Cooldown: Passive

name: X Physeology
effects: This character is made of X, whether trough anomalous or natural means, this also means, depending on what this character is made of, it can be harmful or harmless to touch them.

name: X Slayer
effects: This character is experienced in combat with X type of opponent and gains an attack bonus against them. The more specific the typing, the greater the bonus.

name: X Strider
effects:
This character's agility is raised by 5 when they are on/in X, where X is a type of terrain. However, their agility is lowered by 5 when they are on land. X can be any kind of terrain except on land. Agility can be raised above 10 with this trait. Landstrider is not a valid type of strider.
Cooldown: Passive

name: X Touch
effects:
“Is it worth its weight in gold? Or is it merely led, painted yellow?”
Cooldown: Passive

name: X control
effects:
In which X equals almost anything. This character knows how to control X to their will or even summon X if needed. The power of the X depends on the character's strength and intelligence, and how long the X lasts in their control depends on endurance.
Restrictions: This trait can only be applied to species that have mental powers which allow Xmancy.

name: X's Fault
effects: For whatever reason; this character is blamed for everything that happens nearby.

name: X-body
effects: This character is made of X, whether trough anomalous or natural means, this also means, depending on what this character is made of, it can be harmful or harmless to touch them.

name: X-ritual
effects:
This character uses up a particular resource daily, and will suffer morale losses if unable to do so. Completing this ritual increases morale and sanity by a small amount.
Restrictions: Can be applied to any species, but recommended to balance inorganic species/species who would otherwise not consume rations.

name: XPhobia
effects: This character is scared of whatever X is. This fear may be rational or irrational. Depending on the character their fear may be met with different responses, such as some may become aggressive when one tries to force a fear towards them.

name: Xenophobe
effects: This character has an irrational distaste of all things foreign. This tends to manifest in hatred or fear of foreigners specifically, but may apply to even concepts or objects from other cultures.

name: Xeric
effects: This character can only live in fairly specific conditions, which might not be suitable for general travel on a space ship. For instance, an [Aquatic] character would need to constantly be in water, while a [Xeric] character would need to be constantly heated and dry.

name: Xmancer
effects:
In which X equals almost anything. This character knows how to control X to their will or even summon X if needed. The power of the X depends on the character's strength and intelligence, and how long the X lasts in their control depends on endurance.
Restrictions: This trait can only be applied to species that have mental powers which allow Xmancy.

name: Xmancy
effects:
In which X equals almost anything. This character knows how to control X to their will or even summon X if needed. The power of the X depends on the character's strength and intelligence, and how long the X lasts in their control depends on endurance.
Restrictions: This trait can only be applied to species that have mental powers which allow Xmancy.

name: Yandere
effects: This character is unnaturally loyal to X. They are at hand and foot for X, following without question, willingly putting their lives at risk, even if X is capable enough to take care of it, and they suffer a significant sanity and morale loss if X is hurt, killed, or disappointed/angry at them. As for other characters, they are more likely to be disobedient to them, berate them, and believe they are untrustworthy scum unless said otherwise by X. Characters with this trait sometimes are romantically interested in X and will try anything to impress them.

name: Yeller
effects: This character speaks very loudly or can yell loudly when they want to. As such they slightly better than most at intimidation, but may annoy their crewmates or attract unwanted attention.

name: Yes-Man
effects: This character finds it hard to refuse orders or requests from others, and is easily persuaded to perform tasks.

name: Zealot
effects: This character is very aggressive about their faith, whatever it may be. Having it questioned may lead them to become violent, verbally and/or physically.

name: Zero to Hero
effects:
“Things can only get better...”
Cooldown: Passive
Restrictions: Cannot fix [Dead].

name: Zipper
effects:
This character is hiding under a fake skin. This helps the character blend in with society without being noticed if their skin is has no signs of what lays under it.
Restrictions: Clockwork-only trait.
